classRec.name: MediaPlayerMediaType
classRec.description: The MediaPlayMediaType class provides constant values used to determine the media type playing in the MediaPlayer.

field.name: AUDIO
field.description: The current media track contains audio.

field.name: VIDEO
field.description: The current media track contains video.

classRec.name: MediaPlayerRepeat
classRec.description: The MediaPlayerRepeat class provides constant values used for the MediaPlayer.repeat property.

field.name: ALL
field.description: Specifies that the current playlist repeats.

field.name: NONE
field.description: Specifies that the current playlist does not repeat.

field.name: TRACK
field.description: Specifies that the current track repeats.

classRec.name: MediaPlayerMetadata
classRec.description: The MediaPlayerMedadata class contains constants representing the list of possible metadata properties that may be defined in the metadata object (from the MediaPlayer class).

field.name: ALBUM
field.description: A constant representing the name of the album.

field.name: ARTIST
field.description: A constant representing the name of the artist.

field.name: BITRATE
field.description: A constant representing the bit rate of the track.

field.name: COMMENT
field.description: A constant representing the comment field. The comment field can be used to provide additional information about an artist or album.

field.name: DISC
field.description: A constant representing the number of the disc.

field.name: DURATION
field.description: A constant representing the duration of the track.

field.name: GENRE
field.description: A constant representing the genre of the track.

field.name: MEDIA_TYPE
field.description: A constant representing the media type.

field.name: NAME
field.description: A constant representing the name of the track.

field.name: SAMPLERATE
field.description: A constant that provides information about the sample rate of the track.

field.name: TRACK
field.description: A constant representing the number of the track.

field.name: URL
field.description: A constant that contains URL information for the current track or stream.

field.name: VIDEO_HEIGHT
field.description: A constant that defines the height of the current video track.

field.name: VIDEO_WIDTH
field.description: A constant that defines the width of the current video track.

classRec.name: MediaServiceConnection
classRec.description: The MediaServiceConnection class negotiates access to the media playback engine to prevent multiple clients from playing back audio or video at the same time.

method.name: MediaServiceConnection
method.description: Create a MediaServiceConnection object.

method.name: connect
method.description: Connects to the media service.

method.name: disconnect
method.description: Disconnects from the media service.

method.name: hasAudioService
method.description: Indicates whether you have been granted access to the media engine.
method.return: A Boolean indicating whether or not access was granted. true if access is granted, otherwise false.

method.name: requestAudioService
method.description: Requests access to the media engine.

method.name: sendMetadata
method.description:
Provides the media service with a set of metadata for the current playback. Metadata current used by the MediaService is:
PropertyDescription
albumAlbum name
trackTrack name
durationDuration of track in milliseconds
positionCurrent playback position in milliseonds
albumArtworkurl to album artwork
method.param: metadata The metadata object.

method.name: setPlayState
method.description: Provides the media service with the current state of playback.
method.param: isPlaying A Boolean indicating whether or not the media player is active.

classRec.name: MediaPlayer
classRec.description: The MediaPlayer class can be used to control playback of audio or video files, streams, and track sets (for example, playlists, SQL queries, etc).

Event.name: error
Event.description: Dispatched when an error has occurred during an asynchronous operation.

method.name: MediaPlayer
method.description:
Creates a MediaPlayer object from a URL, with a VideoDisplay.

When done with the MediaPlayer, you should call dispose, to free the resources.
method.param: url The URL to use for playback [optional].
diaplay The VideoDisplay to use for video playback [optional].

method.name: dispose
method.description:
Releases resources associated with this MediaPlayer object.

It is considered good practice to call this method when you're done using the MediaPlayer.

method.name: getPlayQueueMetadata
method.description: Gets the metadata of a track in the play queue, given the offset of the track.
method.param: offset The offset of the track in the queue.

method.name: internal_play
method.description: Handles resetting the track speed and starting playback

method.name: pause
method.description: Pauses playback.

method.name: play
method.description:
Starts or resumes playback.

If playback had previously been paused, playback will continue from where it was paused. If playback had been stopped, or never previously started, playback will start at the beginning.

method.name: prepare
method.description:
Prepares the player for playback.

After setting the URL and/or the VideoDisplay, you can call prepare to start the video subsystem initialization. Once the operation has completed, the MediaPlayerEvent.PREPARE_COMPLETE event is displatched.

method.name: reset
method.description:
Resets the MediaPlayer to its uninitialized state.

After calling this method, you must initialize it again by setting the URL and by calling prepare.

method.name: seek
method.description: Seeks to a given time position and/or track offset.
method.param: msec The offset in milliseconds from the start for which to seek to.
offset The track to seek. If not specified, the current track is used.

method.name: stateChange
method.description: Handle state change events from the renderer and make sure our internal state matches.
method.param: event Renderer state change event parameters

method.name: stop
method.description: Stops playback after playback has been stopped or paused.

method.name: bufferCapacity
method.description: Gets the current buffer size used for playback of the current track in milliseconds.

method.name: bufferLevel
method.description: Gets the current buffer level of the current playing track in milliseconds.

method.name: duration
method.description: Gets the duration of the file that is currently playing in milliseconds.

method.name: isPaused
method.description: Checks whether the MediaPlayer is playing.
method.return: Returns a Boolean indicating whether or not a track is paused.

method.name: isPlaying
method.description: Checks whether the MediaPlayer is playing.
method.return: Returns a Boolean indicating whether or not a track is playing.

method.name: mediaType
method.description: Returns the type of media that is currently playing.
method.return: An integer representing the media type. 4 indicates video, 2 indicates audio.

method.name: metadata
method.description: Returns the metadata that is associated with the current track.

method.name: numTracks
method.description: Returns the number of tracks to play.

method.name: position
method.description: Gets the current playback position of the current track in milliseconds.

method.name: speed
method.description:
Gets or sets the play speed, in units of 1/1000 of normal speed.

For example, speed == 0 is paused, speed == 1000 indicates normal playback speed.

method.name: trackIndex
method.description: Gets the track index of the media playing in the current playlist.

method.name: videoDisplay
method.description:
Gets or sets the VideoDisplay to use for displaying the video portion of the media.

This call is optional.

Not calling this method when playing back a video will result in only the audio track being played.
method.param: display The VideoDisplay to use for video

method.name: repeat
method.description:
Gets or sets the player repeat mode.

Supported modes are:

  • MediaPlayerRepeat.ALL
  • MediaPlayerRepeat.NONE
  • MediaPlayerRepeat.TRACK

method.name: url
method.description: Sets the URL for playback (file-path, http/rtsp URL, etc) to use.
method.param: url The URL to playback.

classRec.name: VideoDisplay
classRec.description: The VideoDisplay class represents the display area of video playback when using the MediaPlayer object.

method.name: VideoDisplay
method.description: Creates a VideoDisplay Object.
method.param: allowOverlay A Boolean indicating whether or not overlay is allowed. true to allow overlay, otherwise false.

method.name: setContext
method.param: MMRContext The multimedia renderer.

method.name: backgroundColor
method.description: The background color of the VideoDisplay object.
method.param: rgb The RGB value of the background color.
method.return: An RGB value representing the background color.

method.name: videoHeight
method.description:
Returns the height of the video, or 0 if there is no video, no display was set, or the height has not been determined yet.

The qnx.events.MediaPlayerEvent.videoChange event can be used to provide a notification when the height is available.

method.name: videoWidth
method.description:
Returns the width of the video, or 0 if there is no video, no display was set, or the width has not been determined yet.

The qnx.events.MediaPlayerEvent.videoChange event can be used to provide a notification when the width is available.

method.name: backgroundColor
method.description: The background color of the VideoDisplay object.

method.name: getObjectLength
method.description: Returns the number of properties an object has
method.param: p_object Object Target object with a number of properties
method.return: Number Number of total properties the object has

method.name: numberToB
method.description: Gets the B (0000xx) bits from a number
method.param: p_num Number Color number (ie, 0xffff00)

method.name: numberToG
method.description: Gets the G (00xx00) bits from a number
method.param: p_num Number Color number (ie, 0xffff00)

method.name: numberToR
method.description: Gets the R (xx0000) bits from a number
method.param: p_num Number Color number (ie, 0xffff00)

method.name: SpecialPropertySplitter
method.description: Builds a new group special property object.
method.param: p_splitFunction Function Reference to the function used to split a value

method.name: toString
method.description: Converts the instance to a string that can be used when trace()ing the object

method.name: SpecialProperty
method.description: Builds a new special property object.
method.param: p_getFunction Function Reference to the function used to get the special property value
p_setFunction Function Reference to the function used to set the special property value

method.name: toString
method.description: Converts the instance to a string that can be used when trace()ing the object

method.name: PropertyInfoObj
method.description: Initializes the basic PropertyInfoObj.
method.param: p_valueStart Number Starting value of the tweening (null if not started yet)
p_valueComplete Number Final (desired) property value

method.name: clone
method.description: Clones this property info and returns the new PropertyInfoObj
method.param: omitEvents Boolean Whether or not events such as onStart (and its parameters) should be omitted
method.return: TweenListObj A copy of this object

method.name: toString
method.description: Returns this object described as a String.
method.return: String The description of this object.

method.name: TweenListObj
method.description: Initializes the basic TweenListObj.
method.param: p_scope Object Object affected by this tweening
p_timeStart Number Time when this tweening should start
p_timeComplete Number Time when this tweening should end
p_useFrames Boolean Whether or not to use frames instead of time
p_transition Function Equation to control the transition animation

method.name: clone
method.description: Clones this tweening and returns the new TweenListObj
method.param: omitEvents Boolean Whether or not events such as onStart (and its parameters) should be omitted
method.return: TweenListObj A copy of this object

method.name: makePropertiesChain
method.description:
Checks if p_obj "inherits" properties from other objects, as set by the "base" property. Will create a new object, leaving others intact.
o_bj.base can be an object or an array of objects. Properties are collected from the first to the last element of the "base" filed, with higher
indexes overwritting smaller ones. Does not modify any of the passed objects, but makes a shallow copy of all properties.
method.param: p_obj Object Object that should be tweened: a movieclip, textfield, etc.. OR an array of objects
method.return: Object A new object with all properties from the p_obj and p_obj.base.

method.name: toString
method.description: Returns this object described as a String.
method.return: String The description of this object.

method.name: SpecialPropertyModifier
method.description: Builds a new special property modifier object.
method.param: p_modifyFunction Function Function that returns the modifider parameters.

method.name: toString
method.description: Converts the instance to a string that can be used when trace()ing the object

packageRec.name: caurina.transitions.null
packageRec.description:
Equations
Main equations for the Tweener class
packageRec.author: Zeh Fernando, Nate Chatellier

method.name: Equations
method.description: There's no constructor.

method.name: easeInBack
method.description: Easing equation function for a back (overshooting cubic easing: (s+1)^3 - s^2) easing in: accelerating from zero velocity.
method.param: t Current time (in frames or seconds).
b Starting value.
c Change needed in value.
d Expected easing duration (in frames or seconds).
s Overshoot ammount: higher s means greater overshoot (0 produces cubic easing with no overshoot, and the default value of 1.70158 produces an overshoot of 10 percent).

method.name: easeInBounce
method.description: Easing equation function for a bounce (exponentially decaying parabolic bounce) easing in: accelerating from zero velocity.
method.param: t Current time (in frames or seconds).
b Starting value.
c Change needed in value.
d Expected easing duration (in frames or seconds).

method.name: easeInCirc
method.description: Easing equation function for a circular (sqrt(1-t^2)) easing in: accelerating from zero velocity.
method.param: t Current time (in frames or seconds).
b Starting value.
c Change needed in value.
d Expected easing duration (in frames or seconds).

method.name: easeInCubic
method.description: Easing equation function for a cubic (t^3) easing in: accelerating from zero velocity.
method.param: t Current time (in frames or seconds).
b Starting value.
c Change needed in value.
d Expected easing duration (in frames or seconds).

method.name: easeInElastic
method.description: Easing equation function for an elastic (exponentially decaying sine wave) easing in: accelerating from zero velocity.
method.param: t Current time (in frames or seconds).
b Starting value.
c Change needed in value.
d Expected easing duration (in frames or seconds).
a Amplitude.
p Period.

method.name: easeInExpo
method.description: Easing equation function for an exponential (2^t) easing in: accelerating from zero velocity.
method.param: t Current time (in frames or seconds).
b Starting value.
c Change needed in value.
d Expected easing duration (in frames or seconds).

method.name: easeInOutBack
method.description: Easing equation function for a back (overshooting cubic easing: (s+1)^3 - s^2) easing in/out: acceleration until halfway, then deceleration.
method.param: t Current time (in frames or seconds).
b Starting value.
c Change needed in value.
d Expected easing duration (in frames or seconds).
s Overshoot ammount: higher s means greater overshoot (0 produces cubic easing with no overshoot, and the default value of 1.70158 produces an overshoot of 10 percent).

method.name: init
method.description:
Registers all the equations to the Tweener class, so they can be found by the direct string parameters.
This method doesn't actually have to be used - equations can always be referenced by their full function
names. But "registering" them make them available as their shorthand string names.

packageRec.name: caurina.transitions.null
packageRec.description:
Tweener
Transition controller for movieclips, sounds, textfields and other objects
packageRec.author: Zeh Fernando, Nate Chatellier, Arthur Debert, Francis Turmel

method.name: Tweener
method.description: There's no constructor.

method.name: addCaller
method.description: Adds a new caller tweening.
method.param: (first-n param) Object that should be tweened: a movieclip, textfield, etc.. OR an array of objects
(last param) Object containing the specified parameters in any order, as well as the properties that should be tweened and their values
.time Number Time in seconds or frames for the tweening to take (defaults 2)
.delay Number Delay time (defaults 0)
.count Number Number of times this caller should be called
.transition String/Function Type of transition equation... (defaults to "easeoutexpo")
.onStart Function Event called when tween starts
.onUpdate Function Event called when tween updates
.onComplete Function Event called when tween ends
.waitFrames Boolean Whether to wait (or not) one frame for each call
method.return: true if the tween was successfully added, false if otherwise.

method.name: addTween
method.description: Adds a new tweening.
method.param: (first-n param) Object Object that should be tweened: a movieclip, textfield, etc.. OR an array of objects
(last param) Object Object containing the specified parameters in any order, as well as the properties that should be tweened and their values
.time Number Time in seconds or frames for the tweening to take (defaults 2)
.delay Number Delay time (defaults 0)
.useFrames Boolean Whether to use frames instead of seconds for time control (defaults false)
.transition String/Function Type of transition equation... (defaults to "easeoutexpo")
.onStart Function Direct property, See the TweenListObj class
.onUpdate Function Direct property, See the TweenListObj class
.onComplete Function Direct property, See the TweenListObj class
.onOverwrite Function Direct property, See the TweenListObj class
.onStartParams Array Direct property, See the TweenListObj class
.onUpdateParams Array Direct property, See the TweenListObj class
.onCompleteParams Array Direct property, See the TweenListObj class
.onOverwriteParams Array Direct property, See the TweenListObj class
.rounded Boolean Direct property, See the TweenListObj class
.skipUpdates Number Direct property, See the TweenListObj class
method.return: Boolean TRUE if the tween was successfully added, FALSE if otherwise

method.name: affectTweens
method.description: Do some generic action on specific tweenings (pause, resume, remove, more?)
method.param: p_function Function Function to run on the tweenings that match
p_scope Object Object that must have its tweens affected by the function
p_properties Array Array of strings that must be affected
method.return: Boolean Whether or not it successfully affected something

method.name: getCurrentTweeningTime
method.description: Get the current tweening time (no matter if it uses frames or time as basis), given a specific tweening
method.param: p_tweening TweenListObj Tween information

method.name: getTweenCount
method.description: Returns the number of properties being tweened for a given object.
method.param: p_scope Target object.
method.return: Total number of properties being tweened (including delayed or paused tweens).

method.name: getTweens
method.description: Returns an array containing a list of the properties being tweened for this object.
method.param: p_scope Target object.
method.return: Total number of properties being tweened (including delayed or paused tweens).

method.name: getVersion
method.description: Return the current tweener version

method.name: init
method.description: Initiates the Tweener--should only be ran once.

method.name: isTweening
method.description: Finds whether or not an object has any tweening.

method.return: true if there's a tweening occuring on this object (paused, delayed, or active), false if otherwise.

method.name: onEnterFrame
method.description: Ran once every frame. It's the main engine; updates all existing tweenings.

method.name: pauseAllTweens
method.description: Pause all tweenings on the engine.

method.name: pauseTweenByIndex
method.description: Pauses a specific tween.
method.param: p_tween Number Index of the tween to be paused
method.return: Boolean Whether or not it successfully paused this tweening

method.name: pauseTweens
method.description: Pause tweenings for a given object.
method.param: p_scope Object that must have its tweens paused
(2nd-last params) Property(ies) that must be paused
method.return: true if it successfully paused any tweening, false if otherwise.

method.name: printError
method.description: Output an error message
method.param: p_message String The error message to output

method.name: registerSpecialPropertyModifier
method.description: Adds a new special property modifier to the available modifier list.

p_modifyFunction Function that modifies the value.
p_getFunction Function that gets the value.

method.name: registerSpecialPropertySplitter
method.description: Adds a new special property splitter to the available splitter list.
method.param: p_name Name of the "special" property splitter.
p_splitFunction Function that splits the value.

method.name: registerSpecialProperty
method.description: Adds a new special property to the available special property list.
method.param: p_name Name of the "special" property.
p_getFunction Function that gets the value.
p_setFunction Function that sets the value.

method.name: registerTransition
method.description: Adds a new function to the available transition list "shortcuts".
method.param: p_name String Shorthand transition name
p_function Function The proper equation function

method.name: removeAllTweens
method.description: Remove all tweenings from the engine.
method.return: true if it successfully removed any tweening, false if otherwise.

method.name: removeTweenByIndex
method.description: Remove a specific tweening from the tweening list.
method.param: p_tween Number Index of the tween to be removed on the tweenings list
method.return: Boolean Whether or not it successfully removed this tweening

method.name: removeTweensByTime
method.description: Remove an specified tweening of a specified object the tweening list, if it conflicts with the given time.
method.param: p_scope Object List of objects affected
p_properties Object List of properties affected (PropertyInfoObj instances)
p_timeStart Number Time when the new tween starts
p_timeComplete Number Time when the new tween ends
method.return: Boolean Whether or not it actually deleted something

method.name: removeTweens
method.description: Remove tweenings from a given object from the tweening list.
method.param: p_tween Object Object that must have its tweens removed
(2nd-last params) Object Property(ies) that must be removed
method.return: Boolean Whether or not it successfully removed this tweening

method.name: resumeAllTweens
method.description: Resume all tweenings on the engine.
method.return: true if it successfully resumed any tweening, false if otherwise.

method.name: resumeTweenByIndex
method.description: Resumes a specific tween.
method.param: p_tween Number Index of the tween to be resumed
method.return: Boolean Whether or not it successfully resumed this tweening

method.name: resumeTweens
method.description: Resume tweenings from a given object.
method.param: p_scope Object Object that must have its tweens resumed
(2nd-last params) Object Property(ies) that must be resumed
method.return: Boolean Whether or not it successfully resumed something

method.name: setTimeScale
method.description: Sets the new time scale.
method.param: p_time Number New time scale (0.5 = slow, 1 = normal, 2 = 2x fast forward, etc)

method.name: splitTweens
method.description: Splits a tweening in two
method.param: p_tween Number Object that must have its tweens split
p_properties Array Array of strings containing the list of properties that must be separated
method.return: Number The index number of the new tween

method.name: startEngine
method.description: Starts the Tweener class engine. It is supposed to be running every time a tween exists.

method.name: stopEngine
method.description: Stops the Tweener class engine.

method.name: updateFrame
method.description: Updates the current frame count

method.name: updateTime
method.description: Updates the time to enforce time grid-based updates.

method.name: updateTweenByIndex
method.description: Updates a specific tween.
method.param: i Number Index (from the tween list) of the tween that should be updated
method.return: Boolean FALSE if it's already finished and should be deleted, TRUE if otherwise

method.name: updateTweens
method.description: Updates all existing tweenings.
method.return: Boolean FALSE if no update was made because there's no tweening (even delayed ones)

method.name: show
method.description:
Shows the dialog as a system or application dialog.

Note: If you're creating a dialog for your application, it's a good idea to pass in a valid group ID:

alert.show(IowWindow.getAirWindow().group); This ensures that the dialog will be modal for only your application. In other words, your application can still be minimized when this dialog is active. If you're creating a system-level dialog, don't pass in a group ID.
method.param: groupId The group ID of the app to attach the dialog to (null to be system dialog).

method.description: Updates the dialog to reflect its current attributes.

method.return: _dialogWidth An integer representing the width of the dialog.

method.name: hideOnButtonClick
method.description:
Gets or sets the a value that determines if the dialog will close when the user clicks a button.

Set to true if the dialog must be cancelled by the caller to be removed from the screen. By default, dialogs are removed when a button is pressed.

method.name: titleHtml
method.description:
Sets the html text for the dialog's title.

The titleHtml function improves the look and feel of your dialogs by providing HTML formatting to text elements. In the following listing, the title text of a dialog is centered using an HTML paragraph tag, and styled using the italic and bold tags.

var dialog:AlertDialog = new AlertDialog(); dlaoig.titleHtml = "<p align='center'><b><i>My HTML formatted title</i></b></p>";

field.name: id
field.public: The ID of the dialog, where each ID is unique to the client owner.

field.name: resp_obj
field.protected: The internal response object used for saving dialog responses.

classRec.name: AlertDialog

method.description: Constructor for the AlertDialog class.

method.name: messageHtml
method.description:
Sets the message TextField's html value.

In addition to providing HTML formatting to message text, the messageHtml method can be used to place images from the web within the message body of a dialog. In the following listing, an external image is placed in the body of a dialog and scaled using the width and height attributes.

var dialog:AlertDialog = new AlertDialog(); dialog.messageHtml = "<img src='http://www.somewebsite.com/somegraphic.jpg' width='500' height='350'/>";

method.name: message
method.description: Sets the value of the message field.

classRec.name: PopupList
classRec.description:
The PopupList class encapsulates the properties of a dropdown or popup list class, which is used to display lists to and allow selection updates by the user.

The following listing shows a dialog with a PopupList. The dialog allows a user to select a wireless network SSID from a group of available networks:

private function showPopup():void { popUp = new PopupList(); popUp.title = "Wireless Networks"; popUp.items = ['Home', 'Work', 'Cottage', 'School']; popUp.addButton("OK"); popUp.addButton("Cancel"); popUp.dialogSize= DialogSize.SIZE_MEDIUM; popUp.addEventListener(DialogEvent.DIALOG_BUTTON_CLICKED, dButtonClicked); popUp.show(IowWindow.getAirWindow().group); }

The code snippet above produces the following dialog:

You can use the selectedIndices method to specify an array of indices. The indices will appear as selected when the dialog is loaded. The multiSelect property enables the user to select multiple list items at once.

Note: In the last line of the code snippet above, the window group ID is passed into the show method:

.show(IowWindow.getAirWindow().group); This ensures that the dialog will be modal for only this application. In other words, the application can still be minimized when this dialog is active.

method.name: PopupList
method.description: Constructor for the PopupList class.

method.name: selectedIndices
method.description: Gets or sets the selected item index array.
method.param: _selected An array of selected list items.

method.name: items
method.description: Sets the list item array.
method.param: An array of list items.

method.name: multiSelect
method.description: Sets a Boolean that allows multiple item selection in the list.
method.param: multi Set to true to allow multi-select, otherwise false.

method.name: selectedIndices
method.description: Sets the selected item index array.
method.param: _selected An array of selected list items.

classRec.name: PasswordChangeDialog
classRec.description:
The PasswordChangeDialog class encapsulates the properties of a password set/change dialog. The password change dialog is used to provide password modification functionality for the device. The user name field is optional to support use cases in which the user name is implicit or there is no user name (e.g., device password).

The following code listing sets up a password change dialog with two buttons, a title, and a message:

private function showPwDialog():void { pw = new PasswordChangeDialog(); pw.title = "Password change"; pw.message = "Please enter your new password:"; pw.addButton("OK"); pw.addButton("Cancel"); pw.dialogSize= DialogSize.SIZE_MEDIUM; pw.addEventListener(DialogEvent.DIALOG_BUTTON_CLICKED, dButtonClicked); pw.show(IowWindow.getAirWindow().group); }

The code snippet above produces the following dialog:

Note: In the last line of the code snippet above, the window group ID is passed into the show method:

.show(IowWindow.getAirWindow().group); This ensures that the dialog will be modal for only this application. In other words, the application can still be minimized when this dialog is active.

The PasswordChangeDialog class extends the LoginDialog class.

method.description: Constructor for the PasswordChangeDialog class.

method.description: Returns the new password confirmation entered by the user.
method.return: A String representing the new password confirmation.

method.description: Returns the new password entered by the user.

method.description:
Sets the confirmation label for the dialog.

If null, a default label is used since the confirmation field is not optional.

method.param: text The confirmation text.

Sets the new password label for the dialog.

If null, a default label is used since the new password field is not optional.

method.description: Sets the new password placeholder text for the user.
method.param: text The password placeholder text.

classRec.name: MediaControlState
classRec.description: The MediaControlState class provides constant values for the MediaControl.setState method.

field.name: PAUSE
field.description: Passed into the MediaControl.setProperty method to indicate that the MediaControl interface should reflect a paused state.

field.name: PLAY
field.description: Passed into the MediaControl.setProperty method to indicate that the MediaControl interface should reflect a playing state.

field.name: SEEK_END
field.description: This is a transitent state and is delivered only though a STATE_CHANGE event when the user lifts their finger off the screen to end a seek interaction and should not be progrmatically set. The state of the MediaControl is not set to this.

field.name: SEEK_START
field.description: This is a transitent state and is delivered only though a STATE_CHANGE event when the user presses down on the seekbar thumb to begin seeking and should not be progrmatically set. The state of the MediaControl is not set to this.

field.name: STOP
field.description: Passed into the MediaControl.setProperty method to indicate that the MediaControl interface should reflect a stopped state.

classRec.name: MediaControlProperty

field.name: DURATION

field.name: FULLSCREEN
field.description: Passed into the MediaControl.setProperty method to set the value of the fullscreen property in the MediaControl component.

field.name: POSITION
field.description: Passed into the MediaControl.setProperty method to set the value of the position property in the MediaControl component.

field.name: VOLUME
field.description: Passed into the MediaControl.setProperty method to set the value of the volume property in the MediaControl component.

classRec.name: MediaControl
classRec.description:
The MediaControl class provides a set of controls that can be used to control media, such as video and audio.

The control itself does not control the media. Instead, it broadcasts events as the user interacts with the controls. You can customize the control by setting options to hide or show interace features.

Event.name: stateChange
Event.description:
Dispatched when the state of the media should change based on user interaction with the controls.

The following cases will cause this event to be dispatched:

  • The user presses the stop button.
  • The user presses the pause button.
  • The user presses the play button.
  • The user touches down on the seek thumb.
  • The user releases the seek thumb.

Event.name: optionClicked
Event.description:
Dispatched when certain elements in the control are touched by the user.

The following cases will cause this event to be dispatched:

  • When the user touches the next button.
  • When the user touches the previous button.

Event.name: propertyChange
Event.description:
Dispatched when a property has changed through user interaction.

The following cases will cause this event to be dispatched:

  • When the user interacts with the seek bar.
  • When the user interacts with the volume slider.
  • When the user presses the fullscreen button.

method.name: MediaControl
method.description: Creates a MediaControl instance.

method.name: getOption
method.description: Returns a Boolean indicating whether or not the option is shown.
method.param: option The option to retrieve.
method.return: Returns true if the option is shown, otherwise false.

method.name: getProperty
method.description:
Gets the current value of the specified property. Each property will return a different data type.
  • MediaControlProperty.DURATION - Returns an int
  • MediaControlProperty.POSITION - Returns an int
  • MediaControlProperty.FULLSCREEN - Returns a Boolean
  • MediaControlProperty.STATE - Returns a String
  • MediaControlProperty.VOLUME - Returns an int

method.name: getState
method.description:
Gets the state of the control.

One of the following values will be returned:

  • MediaControlState.PLAY
  • MediaControlState.PAUSE
  • MediaControlState.STOP
  • MediaControlState.SEEK_START
  • MediaControlState.SEEK_END

method.name: setOption
method.description:
Allows you to hide and show features of the MediaControl class.

By default all items are hidden.

Valid values for the option parameter are:

  • MediaControlOptions.VOLUME
  • MediaControlOptions.FULLSCREEN
  • MediaControlOptions.NEXT
  • MediaControlOptions.PREVIOUS
  • MediaControlOptions.PLAY_PAUSE
  • MediaControlOptions.SEEKBAR
  • MediaControlOptions.STOP
  • MediaControlOptions.DURATION
  • MediaControlOptions.POSITION

The MediaControlOptions.SCRUBBER option will be disabled if MediaControlProperty.DURATION property has not been set using the setProperty method.
method.param: option The option to show or hide.
value When set to true the option is shown. When set to false the option is hidden.

method.name: setProperty
method.description:
Sets a property to the specified value in the MediaControl component.

Valid values for the prop parameter are

  • MediaControlProperty.DURATION
  • MediaControlProperty.POSITION
  • MediaControlProperty.FULLSCREEN
  • MediaControlProperty.VOLUME
The MediaControlProperty.DURATION property expects the duration of the media in milliseconds. The MediaControlProperty.POSITION property expects the position of the media in milliseconds. The MediaControlProperty.FULLSCREEN property expects true if the media is in fullscreen mode or false if it is not. The MediaControlProperty.VOLUME property expects an int value ranging between 0 and 100. Sets a property to the specified value in the MediaControl component. Valid values for the prop param are
  • MediaControlProperty.DURATION
  • MediaControlProperty.POSITION
  • MediaControlProperty.FULLSCREEN
  • MediaControlProperty.VOLUME
The MediaControlProperty.DURATION property expects the duration of the media in milliseconds. The MediaControlProperty.POSITION property expects the position of the media in milliseconds. The MediaControlProperty.FULLSCREEN property expects true if the media is in fullscreen mode or false if it is not. The MediaControlProperty.VOLUME property expects a int value ranging between 0 and 100.

method.name: setState
method.description:
Sets the state of the control.

This method expects one of the following values:

  • MediaControlState.PLAY
  • MediaControlState.PAUSE
  • MediaControlState.STOP
method.param: state The state to set.

classRec.name: ListSelectionMode
classRec.description:
The ListSelectionMode class defines modes that govern list selection. Each mode is defined by one of the following constants:
  • NONE - indicates no selection
  • SINGLE - indicates that a single item can be selected
  • MULTIPLE - indicates that multiple items can be selected

field.name: MULTIPLE
field.description: A constant indicating that multiple cells can be selected.

field.name: NONE
field.description: A constant indicating no selection.

field.name: SINGLE
field.description: A constant indicating that only a single cell can be selected.

field.description: A constant representing both horizontal and vertical scrolling.

field.name: HORIZONTAL
field.description: A constant representing horizontal scrolling.

field.name: NONE
field.description: A constant representing no scrolling.

field.name: VERTICAL
field.description: A constant representing vertical scrolling.

Event.name: scrollMove
Event.description: Dispatched when the scroll pane is moving

Event.description: Dispatched when the scroll pane has started scrolling

Event.name: scrollEnded
Event.description: Dispatched when the scroll pane has finished scrolling.

method.name: ScrollPane
method.description: Creates a ScrollPane instance.

method.name: addScrollContent
method.description:
Adds content to the scroll pane.

You can add an item to the scroll pane by passing either a class reference, a String linkage identifier, or an instance of a DisplayObject.
method.param: content The content to be added to the scroll pane.
method.return: Returns the item that was added.

method.name: getScrollContent
method.description: Returns the scroll pane content as a DisplayObject.
method.return: A DisplayObject containing the scroll pane content.

method.name: removeScrollContent
method.description: Removes all content from the scroll pane.

method.name: update
method.description:
Refreshes the scroll pane properties based on the width and height of the content.

Call this function if the content of the ScrollPane changes during run time.

method.name: scrollDirection
method.description:
Sets a String representing the scroll direction of the scroll pane.

The direction argument can be NONE (unable to scroll), BOTH (can scroll in both directions if content exceeds pane height or width), HORIZONTAL (can only scroll horizontally) and VERTICAL (only on the vertical).

method.name: scrollX
method.description:
Sets the x position of the content item given a pixel value.

The minimum value is 0 pixels, and the maximum value is equal to the width of the content item.
method.param: xpos The x value of the scroll pane content.

method.name: scrollDirection
method.description:
Sets a String representing the scroll direction of the scroll pane.

The direction argument can be NONE (unable to scroll ), BOTH (can scroll in both directions if content exceeds pane height or width), HORIZONTAL (can only scroll horizontally) and VERTICAL (only on the vertical).

method.name: scrollY
method.description:
Sets the y position of the content item given a pixel value.

The minimum value is 0 pixels, and the maximum value is equal to the height of the content item.
method.param: ypos The y value of the scroll pane content.

Returns a Boolean indicating whether or not a cell at a given index is visible in the virtual area.

This includes cells which are not fully in the view of the list.

method.name: replaceItem
method.description: Replaces an item, given the new item object and the old item.
method.param: item The new item object data.
oldObject The item to replace.

method.name: scrollIndexVisible
method.description:
Scrolls a given item into view, given an index and an animation duration (in seconds).

This function checks to see if the cell is currently visible before scrolling it into view. If the cell is not fully visible within the viewport of the list, it will scroll it into the viewport. If the cell is fully visible in the viewport, the list will scroll.
method.param: index The index of the cell to animate into view.
seconds The duration of the animation in seconds. Default is 1 second.

method.name: scrollToIndex
method.description: Animates the cell at the specified index into view.
method.param: index The index of the cell to animate into view.
seconds The duration of the animation in seconds. Default is 1 second.

method.name: setItemPosition
method.param: item The item to position.
pos The position of the item.

method.name: setSkin
updateItemAt
method.description: Updates the item in the list at the specified index, given the new item.
method.param: item The new, or updated, item.
index The index of the item to update.
method.throws: RangeError thrown if the specified index is less than 0 or greater than or equal to the length of the DataProvider.

method.name: updateItem
method.description: Updates an item in the list, given the new item and the item to update.
method.param: value The new, or updated item.
oldObject The item to update.

method.name: allowDeselect
method.description: Determines if a selected cell in the list can be deselected when pressed.
method.default: true - By default, cells can be deselected

method.name: columnWidth
method.description:
Gets or sets the width of each column in the list.

This value is used in order to lay out the cells in a horizontally list. This value is passed to each renderer, to ensure that a renderer does not draw beyond this value.

method.name: dataProvider
method.description:
Gets or sets the DataProvider instance for the list.

When the data is updated, an Event.CHANGE is dispatched from the list. If set to null, the list creates an empty DataProvider instance and all current items are removed. You can also use the DataProvider API in order to modify the data in the list.

method.name: firstVisibleItem
method.description: Returns the first visible item in the view port area as defined by the width and height

method.name: footerView
method.description:
Gets or sets the footer view.

A footer view is any display object that can be anchored to the last item in the list. You can add a footer view to add items to a list, such as a "Load More" button at the end of a list. The footer view has an x position value set to 0, can be any DisplayObject, and does not have to implement the ICellRenderer interface.Because the footer view can be any DisplayObject, the list does not resize it to match the dimensions of the list.

To remove the current footer view from the list, set the footerView property to null.

method.name: rowHeight
method.description:
Gets or sets the height of each row in the list.

This value is used in order to lay out the cells in a vertical list. This value is passed to each renderer, to ensure that a renderer does not draw beyond this value.

method.name: scrollBarAlpha
method.description:
Gets or sets the opacity value for the scroll bar on the list.

When the list is pressed it reveals the scroll bar. The scroll bar alpha determines the opacity of the scroll bar when it is revealed.

method.name: scrollBarColor
method.description: Gets or sets the color of the scroll bar.

method.name: scrollBarOffset
method.description:
Gets or sets the x or y postion of the scrollbar.

The offset value is relative to the scrollDirection property.

method.name: scrollDirection
method.description:
Gets and sets the scroll direction of the list.

There are two directions a list can be scrolled. These are defined in ScrollDirection class:

  • ScrollDirection.HORIZONTAL - indicates horizontal scrolling
  • ScrollDirection.VERTICAL - indicates vertical scrolling

method.name: scrollable
method.description:
Gets or sets a value that determines whether a list can be scrolled.

When set to true the list can be scrolled. When set to false the list will not scroll, however cells can still be selected.

method.name: selectedIndex
method.description:
Gets or sets the index of the currently selected item in a single-selection list.

In a single-selection list, only one item can be selected at a time. A value of -1 indicates that no item is selected. If multiple selections are made, this value is equal to the index of the item that was selected last in the group of selected items.

When the selection is changed programmatically, the item at the specified index replaces the current selection. A change event object is not dispatched.

method.name: selectedIndices
method.description: Gets or sets the selected cells at the specified indices in a multi-selectable list.

method.name: selectedItem
method.description: Gets or sets the currently selected item in a single-selectable list.
method.throws: ArgumentError thrown if the specified item is not currently in the dataProvider of the list.

method.name: selectedItems
method.description: Gets or sets the group of selected items (selectedItems) in a multi-selectable list.
method.throws: ArgumentError thrown if one of the specified item is not currently in the dataProvider of the list.

method.name: selectionMode
method.description:
Gets or sets a value that determines whether or not selection mode is enabled.

Selection mode determines how a user interacts with a list by controlling how items are selected and unselected when clicked. For example, depending on the selection mode a user can select multiple items or only a single item at any one time.

Valid values are:

  • ListSelectionMode.NONE - indicates that cells are not selected when pressed
  • ListSelectionMode.SINGLE - indicates that only a single cell can be selected at a given time
  • ListSelectionMode.MULTIPLE - indicates that multiple cells can be selected at any given time

If the selectionMode property is changed at runtime, the current list selection will be cleared.

method.name: scrollDirection
method.description:
Scroll direction determines if the list can be scrolled horizontally or vertically.

There are two directions a list can be scrolled and these are defined in ScrollDirection class: ScrollDirection.HORIZONTAL - horizontally scrolling or ScrollDirection.VERTICAL - vertically scrolling.

classRec.name: CellRenderer
classRec.description:
The CellRenderer class provides the base functionality for cell renderers in any of the list classes, such as List, TileList, SectionList, and SectionTileList.

The CellRenderer class consists of a skin and a label.

method.name: CellRenderer
method.description: Creates a CellRenderer instance.

method.param: state The state (as a String) for the TextFormat object to return.
method.return: The TextFormat object for the specified state.

method.name: setTextFormatForState
method.description:
Sets the TextFormat object for the label of a given state.

Valid states are SkinStates.UP, SkinStates.DOWN, SkinStates.SELECTED, SkinStates.DISABLED.
method.param: format The TextFormat to set.
state The state for which to change the TextFormat.

method.description: Gets or sets the column of the cell.

method.description:
Gets or sets the data object for the cell renderer.

The set method expects the data object to contain a non-null label property. This property is used to set an internal label textfield.

classRec.name: TileList
classRec.description:
The TileList class can be used to display a list of cells in a grid format.

When the list is set to scroll vertically, the columnCount property is used to layout the grid. You can use the rowHeight and columnWidth height properties to set the dimensions of each cell. You can use the cellPadding property to set the padding between each cell.

method.name: TileList
method.description: Creates a new TileList instance.

method.name: cellPadding
method.description: Gets or sets the amount of padding between cells (in pixels) in the grid.

method.name: columnCount
method.description: Gets or sets the number of columns in the grid.

method.name: rowCount
method.description: Gets or sets the number of rows in the list.

classRec.name: SectionList
classRec.description:
The SectionList class allows you to group sections of data in a list.

For example, you can group a list of contacts based on the letters in the alphabet. You can provide custom headers for your list by calling the setHeader method. Your header must set the ICellRenderer.isHeader to true.

method.name: SectionList
method.description: Creates a new SectionList instance.

method.name: addChildToIndexAt
method.description: Adds an item to a section at a specified index.
method.param: item The item to add.
index The index of the section for which to add the item.
childindex The index of the item in the section.
method.throws: RangeError thrown if the specified index is less than 0 or greater than or equal to the length of the data provider.
RangeError thrown if the specified childindex is less than 0 or greater than or equal to the length of the section.

method.param: item The item to add to the list.
index The index of the section for which to add the item.

method.name: removeAllChildrenFromIndex
method.description: Removes all items from a section at the specified index.

childindex The index of the child in the section.
method.throws: RangeError thrown if the specified index is less than 0 or greater than or equal to the length of the data provider.

method.description: Replaces an item in a section at a specified index.

item The new item.
childindex The index of the item in the section.
method.throws: RangeError thrown if the specified index is less than 0 or greater than or equal to the length of the data provider.
RangeError thrown if the specified childindex is less than 0 or greater than or equal to the length of the section.

method.name: scrollIndexVisible
method.description:
Scrolls a given item into view, given an index and an animation duration (in seconds).

This function checks to see if the cell is currently visible before scrolling it into view. If the cell is not fully visible within the viewport of the list, it will scroll it into the viewport. If the cell is fully visible in the viewport, the list will scroll.
method.param: index The index of the cell to animate into view.
seconds The duration of the animation in seconds. Default is 1 second.

method.name: scrollToIndexInSection
method.description: Animates the child of a section into view.
method.param: section The section that contains the child.
index The index of the child for which to animate to.
seconds The duration of the animation in seconds. Default is 1 second.

method.name: scrollToIndex
method.description: Animates the section into view so that the header is at the top of the list.
method.param: index The index of the section for which to animate.
seconds The duration of the animation in seconds. Default is 1 second.

method.name: setHeaderSkin
method.description:
Sets the header renderer to be used in order to group sections in the list.

You can pass in a qualified class name String, as well as the actual class. In either instance the class that is used must implement the ICellRenderer interface.

method.name: updateChildInIndexAt
method.description: Updates an item in a section at a specified index.
method.param: index The index of the section.
item The new item.
childindex The index of the item in the section.
method.throws: RangeError thrown if the specified index is less than 0 or greater than or equal to the length of the data provider.
RangeError thrown if the specified childindex is less than 0 or greater than or equal to the length of the section.

method.description: Gets or sets the height of the header (in pixels).

method.name: headerWidth
method.description: Gets or sets the width of the header (in pixels).

method.name: dataProvider

Gets or sets the DataProvider for the list.

Unlike the List class, the dataProvider property for the SectionList class must be of type ISectionDataProvider class.

method.name: selectedIndex

method.name: selectedIndices
method.description: Setting the selectedIndices property will have no effect on the list and will cause an error to be thrown. Use selectedItems instead.
method.throws: Error An error stating the selectedIndices cannot be set.

classRec.name: SectionTileList
classRec.description:
The SectionTileList class allows you to group sections of data in a grid.

When the list is set to scroll vertically, the columnCount property is used to layout the grid. You can use the rowHeight and columnWidth height properties to set the dimensions of each cell. You can use the cellPadding property to set the padding between each cell.

method.name: SectionTileList
method.description: Creates a new SectionTileList instance.

method.name: cellPadding
method.description: Gets or sets the amount of padding used between each cell in the grid.

method.name: columnCount
method.description: Gets or sets the number of columns in the grid.

method.name: scrollDirection
method.description: A section tile list can only be scrolled vertically and will return a scroll direction of VERTICAL.

classRec.name: AlternatingCellRenderer
classRec.description:
The AlternatingCellRenderer class is the default cell renderer for the List class.

As the name suggests, AlternatingCellRenderer renders the cells in the list using alternating row colors, such that each adjacent row uses a different color.

method.name: AlternatingCellRenderer
method.description: Creates a new AlternatingCellRenderer instance.

classRec.name: DropDownCellRenderer
classRec.description: The DropDownCellRenderer class is the cell renderer that is used for the drop down list.

method.name: DropDownCellRenderer
method.description: Creates a new DropDownCellRenderer instance.

classRec.name: SectionHeaderRenderer
classRec.description:
The SectionHeaderRenderer class is the default header skin for the SectionList and SectionTileList classes.

You can create your own headers, but you must set the ICellRenderer.isHeader to true. To set your own custom header, call the setHeaderSkin method in the SectionList and SectionTileList classes.

method.name: SectionHeaderRenderer
method.description: Creates a SectionHeaderRenderer instance.

classRec.name: ContainerFlow
classRec.description: The ContainerFlow class defines the flow options for children within a Container.

field.name: HORIZONTAL
field.description: A constant representing horizontal flow within the container.

field.name: VERTICAL
field.description: A constant representing vertical flow within the container.

classRec.name: SizeMode
classRec.description: The SizeMode class contains the constant values that define the component sizing mode when being laid out in a container.

field.name: BOTH
field.description: A constant representing component sizing of the component in both the flow and opposite flow directions.

field.name: FLOW
field.description: A constant representing component sizing only in the direction of the container's flow.

classRec.name: ContainerAlign
classRec.description: The ContainerAlign class defines the align options for children within a Container. Container align options are relative to the origin (upper left) and flow container of the container.

field.name: FAR
field.description: A constant used to align the child component to the far side of the container area.

field.name: MID
field.description: A constant used to align the child component to the center of the container area.

field.name: NEAR
field.description: A constant used to align the child component to the near side of the container area.

classRec.name: Containment
classRec.description: The Containment class contains values that are used to define layout options within a container.

field.name: BACKGROUND
field.description: A constant indicating that this object will be sized to fill the entire region of the container.

field.name: CONTAINED
field.description: A constant indicating that this object will be contained in the free area of the container.

field.name: DOCK_BOTTOM
field.description: A constant indicating that this object will be docked to the bottom side of the container.

field.name: DOCK_LEFT
field.description: A constant indicating that this object will be docked to the left side of the container.

field.name: DOCK_RIGHT
field.description: A constant indicating that this object will be docked to the right side of the container.

field.name: DOCK_TOP
field.description: A constant indicating that this object will be docked to the top side of the container.

field.name: UNCONTAINED
field.description: A constant indicating that this object will be ignored (not positioned during layout) by the container.

classRec.name: SizeUnit
classRec.description: The SizeUnit class contains the constant values that define the unit of measure for container sizing.

field.name: PERCENT
field.description: A constant representing the unit of measure as a percentage.

field.name: PIXELS
field.description: A constant representing the pixel as the unit of measure.

The interface for the qnx.ui.core package.

The IContainable interface provides container sizing and placement functionality.

interfaceRec.name: IContainable
interfaceRec.description: The IContainable interface provides the methods and properties that enable definitions for container layout.

method.description: Called by the container to set the position of the component relative to the position of the container.
method.param: x The x position in pixels for the component.
y The y position in pixels for the component.

method.name: containment
method.description:
Specifies how a component is to be contained within a parent container. Possible values are:
  • Containment.BACKGROUND
  • Containment.UNCONTAINED
  • Containment.CONTAINED
  • Containment.DOCK_LEFT
  • Containment.DOCK_TOP
  • Containment.DOCK_RIGHT
  • Containment.DOCK_BOTTOM

method.name: sizeMode
method.description:
Gets or sets the size mode for this component. This property is used by containers when laying out the component. Possible values are:
  • SizeMode.FLOW
  • SizeMode.BOTH

Note that this property is ignored when size is 0.

method.name: sizeUnit
method.description:
Gets or sets the unit of measurement for the size property. Possible values are:
  • SizeUnit.PERCENT
  • SizeUnit.PIXELS

method.description:
Gets or sets the size for this component (as a percentage of the container's size, or in pixels). This property is used by containers to layout this component in the appropriate direction.

If size is 0, the component is not resized during container layout (it is positioned like any other MovieClip, Sprite or DisplayObject).

classRec.name: UIComponent
classRec.description: The UIComponent class is the base class for all components.

method.name: UIComponent
method.description: Creates a new UIComponent instance.

method.name: createInstance
method.description:
Calling this method will attempt to create a DisplayObject instance based on the value of the linkage parameter.

The linkage parameter can be one of three different types: Class, String, or DisplayObject instance.

  • If you pass in a Class, a new instance of that class is created and returned.
  • If you pass in a String, the flash.utils.getDefinitionByName will attempt to create a new method.
  • If you pass in a DisplayObject instance, the x and y values of the instance are set to 0 and returned.
method.param: linkage The instance to create.
method.return: A DisplayObject instance of the specified object.

method.name: destroy
method.description:
Call this method when you want to have your object collected by the garbage collector.

NOTE: This method does not remove the object from memory. Instead, it enables your instance to clean up after itself internally so that it can be garbage-collected.

method.name: draw
method.description:
Called every time you set the width and height of the component.

Subclassing this method allows you to redraw and set the layout for the children of the component in order to accomodate the new dimensions. If you decide to implement your own draw method, you should avoid calling super.draw, as this will cause the physical dimensions of your component to be resized.

method.name: onAdded
method.description:
Called when the instance is added to the stage.

This method can be overwritten in your subclasses. This method is called when the Event.ADDED_TO_STAGE is fired.

method.name: onRemoved
method.description:
Called when the instance is removed from the stage.

This method can be overwritten in your subclasses. This method is called when the Event.REMOVED_FROM_STAGE is fired.

method.name: setEnabled
method.description:
Called when the enabled property changes.

You can override this method in order to customize how your component sets the enabled property.
method.param: val A Boolean indicating the state of the enabled property.

method.description: Sets the x and y position of the component.
method.param: x The new x position to be set.
y The new y position to be set.

method.name: setSize
method.description:
Sets the width and height of the component.

After setting the new dimensions, the setSize function calls the draw method, which allows you to adjust the layout or redraw your component's children.
method.param: w The new width of the component.
h The new height of the component.

method.name: containment
method.description:
Gets or sets how a component is contained within a parent container.

Possible values are:

  • Containment.BACKGROUND
  • Containment.UNCONTAINED
  • Containment.CONTAINED
  • Containment.DOCK_LEFT
  • Containment.DOCK_TOP
  • Containment.DOCK_RIGHT
  • Containment.DOCK_BOTTOM

method.param: val A Boolean indicating the state of the component.
method.return: Returns true if the component is enabled, false otherwise.

  • SizeMode.FLOW
  • SizeMode.BOTH
Note this property is ignored when size is 0.

method.name: sizeUnit
method.description:
Gets or sets the unit of measure for the size property.

Possible values are:

  • SizeUnit.PIXELS
