method.description:
Gets or sets the size for this component (as a percentage of the container's size, or in pixels). This property is used by containers to layout this component in the appropriate direction.

If the size is 0, the component is not resized during container layout (it is positioned like any other MovieClip, Sprite or DisplayObject).

classRec.name: SkinnableComponent
classRec.description: The SkinnableComponent class is the base class for components that can be skinned.

method.name: setSkin
method.description:
Set the skin object on the component for it to render.

If a skin is found, it is removed and a new skin is created. The cellSkin parameter can be one of three different types: Class, String, or DisplayObject instance.

  • If you pass in a Class, a new instance of that class is created and returned.
  • If you pass in a String, the flash.utils.getDefinitionByName will attempt to create a new method.
  • If you pass in a DisplayObject instance, the x and y values of the instance are set to 0 and returned.

Skins must implement the ISkin interface.

method.name: setState
method.param: state A String representing the state to be set. Valid values are SkinStates.UP, SkinStates.DOWN, SkinStates.SELECTED, SkinStates.DISABLED.

classRec.name: Container
classRec.description:
The Container class is the basic "container" that contains the interface components of an application. It handles the positioning, size, and layout of its children. Containers are useful for segmenting the screen into compartments, and for organizing the layout and flow of all components within a compartment.

The following example describes a typical layout scenario using containers:

The layout above uses four containers, where the border and margin of each container is highlighted in a unique colour. This is done by setting the container's debugColor property to a unique color code. The debugColor property is useful for visualizing the bounds of each container while you develop your application. This allows you to tweak the details of the layout.

The main container, myMain (yellow), encompasses the entire stage and contains the three subcontainers: mySub, mySubRight, and mySubBottom. The following code listing shows the myMain container:

myMain = new Container(); myMain.margins = Vector.<Number>([20,20,20,20]); myMain.flow = ContainerFlow.HORIZONTAL; myMain.debugColor = 0xFFCC00; addChild(myMain); Flow and alignment

The flow indicates the layout orientation, or direction of all subcomponents (children) within a parent container. The myMain container's flow property is set to ContainerFlow.HORIZONTAL meaning that the container's children (which may also be containers) will appear horizontally opposed, or side by side within the container. The margins property takes a Vector of four numbers indicating, in order, margins for the the left, top, right, and bottom edges of the container. So Vector.<Number>([20,40,20,40]), would indicate top and bottom margins of 40 pixels, and left and right margins of 20 pixels. A component will only overlap a margin if the container runs out of space. For the sake of the sample, the margin values are specified using literals.

The code for the mySub (red) container, which makes up the left side of the screen, is listed below:

// create subcontainer on left side of the screen // mySub = new Container(); mySub.margins = Vector.<Number>([20,40,20,40]); mySub.debugColor = 0xFF3300; mySub.size = 50; mySub.sizeUnit = SizeUnit.PERCENT; mySub.flow = ContainerFlow.VERTICAL; mySub.align = ContainerAlign.NEAR; mySub.padding = 10;

The mySub container uses a vertical flow (ContainerFlow.VERTICAL) meaning that all components within this container will appear vertically opposed, or one on top of another. It's also important to note that components will appear in the order in which they are added to a container, such that the top-most component in the mySub container will be the component that is first added to the container. This is always true unless a component is docked, which is described later.

The size and sizeUnit properties determine the size of the subcontainer, or rather, the amount of space the subcontainer will take up within the parent container. In this case, size is set to 50 and sizeUnit is set to SizeUnit.PERCENT indicating that mySub will take up 50% of the main container. The default value of sizeUnit is pixels.

The align property determines the position, or alignment, of each subcomponent in the direction opposite to the flow of the container. In a container with a vertical flow, this specifies the horizontal position (or x coordinate) of the subcomponent, relative to the left edge of the container. Conversely, in a container with a horizontal flow, the alignment specifies the vertical position (or y coordinate) of the component relative to the top edge of the container. The align property has three values: ContainerAlign.NEAR, ContainerAlign.MID,and ContainerAlign.FAR, where each value represents a position relative to the initial edge of the container. ContainerAlign.NEAR is the closest, ContainerAlign.FAR is the furthest. ContainerAlign.MID is the default.

The padding property sets the amount of space (in pixels) between each subcomponent.

The sub container, mySubRight on the right-side of the screen is listed below:

mySubRight = new Container(); mySubRight.margins = Vector.<Number>([10,10,10,10]); mySubRight.size = 50; mySubRight.debugColor = 0x0033FF; mySubRight.sizeUnit = SizeUnit.PERCENT; mySubRight.flow = ContainerFlow.VERTICAL; mySubRight.align = ContainerAlign.MID; mySubRight.padding = 10;

The final container, mySubBottom (green), is listed below:

// create subcontainer as the bottom frame // mySubBottom = new Container(); mySubBottom.margins = Vector.<Number>([5,5,5,5]); mySubBottom.debugColor = 0x33FF33; mySubBottom.size = 9; mySubBottom.sizeUnit = SizeUnit.PERCENT; mySubBottom.flow = ContainerFlow.HORIZONTAL; mySubBottom.align = ContainerAlign.FAR; mySubBottom.containment = Containment.DOCK_BOTTOM;

This container is docked to the bottom of the stage by setting the containment property to Containment.DOCK_BOTTOM. Docked children are handled first, leaving the remainder of the container for the rest of the children. You can dock a subcomponent to any of the four edges of a container, you can set a container to reside in the background of the stage (Containment.BACKGROUND), or you can specify that the component will not repositioned by the parent container (Containment.UNCONTAINED).

Sizing

A container can set the size of each subcomponent in the direction of the flow, only if the subcomponent implements the IContainable interface and only if IContainable.size is not 0. Otherwise, the subcomponents dimensions are not changed during a layout operation.

A container can set the size of a subcomponent in the direction opposite the container flow (height in a horizontal container, width in a vertical container) only if the subcomponent implements IContainable and IContainable.sizeMode is set to SizeMode.BOTH. When this property is set, the subcomponent will fill the remaining container space (in the direction opposite to the flow of the container) and the container's align setting will be ignored.

The Back button uses the SizeMode property to fill out the opposite direction in the bottom container. In other words, after a layout call, the Back button will expand vertically (note that the container uses a horizontal flow) to fill the space in the bottom container:

leftButton = new LabelButton(); leftButton.label = "Back"; leftButton.size = 100; leftButton.sizeUnit = SizeUnit.PIXELS; leftButton.sizeMode = SizeMode.BOTH;

Note that you must specify a size for the component (using the size property) otherwise the component will not resize when a layout call occurs. For the sake of the example, the Next button does not specify the SizeMode property.

rightButton = new LabelButton(); rightButton.label = "Next"; rightButton.size = 100; Spacing

The Back and Next buttons are positioned at the far bottom-right side of the container. This is accomplished by setting the align property to ContainerAlign.FAR but also by adding a spacer as the first subcomponent in the container. By default, the spacer is set to take up 100 percent of the container, which pushes the other two components to the far right of the container. Notice that a second spacer is added to provide spacing between the buttons. This could also have been accomplished by using the padding property.

mySubBottom.addChild(new Spacer()); mySubBottom.addChild(leftButton); mySubBottom.addChild(new Spacer(3,SizeUnit.PIXELS)); mySubBottom.addChild(rightButton);

Finally, and perhaps most importantly, we call the myMain container's setSize method, which sets the size of the main container:

//call setSize // myMain.setSize(stage.stageWidth, stage.stageHeight);

This in turn calls the layout() function which adjusts the layout of the subcomponents according to the properties that are defined by each parent container. It's important to call this method only after each container and each subcomponent is defined. Otherwise, the call will have no effect.

The complete code for this layout is listed in the examples section below.

method.name: Container
method.description: Constructs a Container instance given a size and size unit.
method.param: s A Number representing the size of the container. The default value is 100 (the default unit is percent).
su A String representing the unit. Can be one of SizeUnit.PERCENT or SizeUnit.PIXELS. The default value is SizeUnit.PERCENT.

method.name: layout
method.description:
Repositions the children of the container according to the flow and align settings of the container, and the containment and sizing attributes (if present) of the children.

Invisible children are not positioned by a container.

A child is considered docked if it implements the IContainable interface and its containment property is set to Containment.DOCK_LEFT, Containment.DOCK_TOP, Containment.DOCK_RIGHT or Containment.DOCK_BOTTOM. Children which implement IContainable and specify a containment of Containment.UNCONTAINED will be ignored by the container. Children which specify a containment of Containment.BACKGROUND will be sized to fill the entire area of the container.

A child is considered resizable if it implements the IContainable interface and its size property is greater than 0.

Containers will position docked children first around the edges of the container. They will then will position undocked children in the remaining area of the container. Undocked children which are resizable will be positioned and sized based on their size (and sizeUnit) property in the direction of the container flow, and will fill the remaining space in the direction opposite the flow.

Undocked children which are not resizable will be positioned based on their width and height properties in the direction of the container flow, and will be aligned in the direction opposite the container flow based on the container's align property.

method.name: setSize
method.description:
Called by the parent (other containers or the outer most parent) to set the size of the container.

The container will invoke layout automatically in response to this.
method.param: width The new width (in pixels) for the Container component.
height The new height (in pixels) for the Container component.

method.name: margins
method.description: Gets or sets the internal margins for the container (the space just inside the border of the container). The m argument is represented as a vector of 4 numbers: the left, top, right and bottom edges respectively.

method.name: margins
method.description: Specifies the internal margins for the container (the space just inside the border of the container). margins is represented as a vector of 4 numbers, specifying the margins in pixels for the left, top, right and bottom edges respectively.

method.name: padding
method.description:
Specifies the internal padding in pixels for the container (the space
between contained children of the container).

field.name: align
field.description:
Specifies the align, with which contained and non-resizable children are positioned.

The align attribute is used to determine the position of the childen in the direction opposite to the flow of the container, with near implying upper or left-most, and far implying lower or right-most. This applies only to children which do not implement the IContainable interface or those which specify a 0 size.

Possible values are:
  • ContainerAlign.NEAR
  • ContainerAlign.MID
  • ContainerAlign.FAR

field.name: flow
field.description:
Specifies the flow direction, with which any contained children are positioned.

Possible values are:

  • ContainerFlow.VERTICAL
  • ContainerFlow.HORIZONTAL

classRec.name: DeviceBatteryState
classRec.description: The battery power state of the device.

field.name: CHARGING
field.description: A constant indicating that the battery power state is plugged into power and is less then 100% charged.

field.name: FULL
field.description: A constant indicating that the battery power state is plugged into power and is at 100% charge.

field.name: UNKNOWN
field.description: A constant indicating that the battery power state is unknown.

field.name: UNPLUGGED
field.description: A constant indicating that the battery power state is unplugged from power and is discharging.

classRec.name: QNXApplication
classRec.description: The QNXApplication class contains system information, system-wide functions, and dispatches system events.

Event.name: swipeDown
Event.description: Dispatched when the user swipes down from the top bezel onto the application screen.

Event.name: swipeStart
Event.description: Dispatched when the user initiates a swipe down from the top bezel onto the application screen.

Event.name: lowMemory
Event.description: Dispatched when the device is running low on memory.

method.name: QNXApplication
method.description: The constructor of the QNXApplication class. This should never be called directly. Use the QNXApplication.qnxApplication to create an instance.
method.param: enforcer Used to prevent direct construction of this class.

method.name: openFile
method.description:
Opens the given file in the default application for that file type.

If the file type is not known by the device, the file is not opened. Before attempting to open a file, check the QNXApplication.supportedFileTypes Vector array to see if the file is a valid file extension.
method.param: filePath The path to the file on the device.

method.name: qnxApplication
method.description: Returns the Singleton instance of the QNXApplication class.

method.name: supportedFileTypes
method.description: A Vector array (a typed array of String values) of file extensions which can be opened in the default application on the device.

classRec.name: Device
classRec.description: The Device class exposes many properties of the device. Use the public static method Device.device to retrieve a reference to the current device.

method.name: Device
method.description: Do not use the constructor to instanitate a instance of this class. Use the Device.device method to return the Singleton instance of the class.
method.param: enforcer Used to prevent calling the constructor directly.

method.name: toString
method.description: Returns a String containing device, software, and hardware information.

method.name: batteryLevel
method.description:
Returns the battery level of the device.

If the batteryMonitoringEnabled property is set to true, a value between 0 and 100 will be returned indicating the battery level. If the batteryMonitoringEnabled property is set to false, -1 is returned indicating that the battery level is unknown.

method.name: batteryMonitoringEnabled
method.description:
Turns battery monitoring on or off.

When set to true, DeviceBatteryEvent.LEVEL_CHANGE and DeviceBatteryEvent.STATE_CHANGE events will be dispatched whenever changes to the battery level and state occur. When set to false, events will not be fired.

method.name: batteryState
method.description:
Returns the battery state of the device.

If the batteryMonitoringEnabled property is set to false, DeviceBatteryState.UNKNOWN is returned as the state is unknown. If the batteryMonitoringEnabled property is set to true, the battery state will be returned.

The following are valid values:

  • DeviceBatteryState.UNKNOWN
  • DeviceBatteryState.FULL
  • DeviceBatteryState.CHARGING
  • DeviceBatteryState.UNPLUGGED

classRec.name: LabelPlacement
classRec.description: The LabelPlacement class contains constants that define how a label is placed next to a skin or icon.

field.description: Position the label below the skin or icon.

field.name: TOP

classRec.name: RadioButtonGroup
classRec.description: The RadioButtonGroup class contains the functionality for handling a group of related radio buttons.

Event.name: change
Event.description: Dispatched when the selection property of the group changes.

method.name: RadioButtonGroup
method.description:
Do not use this constructor.

Instead, use the getGroup method to create a RadioButtonGroup instance.

method.name: addButton
method.description: Adds a button of type RadioButton to the group.
method.param: button The button to add to the group. Must be of type RadioButton.

method.name: getGroup
method.description: Returns a radio button group object given a unique name. Use this method in order to create a new RadioButtonGroup instance.
method.param: name The name of the group.

method.name: getUniqueId
method.description: Returns a unique ID to ensure radio group IDs are not duplicated.

method.name: removeButton
method.description: Removes the specified button from the group (assuming the button exists).
method.param: button The RadioButton to remove from the group.

method.name: setSelectedRadioButton
method.description: Sets the specified radio button to selected.
method.param: button The button to set to selected. Must be of type RadioButton.

method.name: length
method.description: Returns the number of buttons that have been added to the group.
method.return: int An Integer representing the number of buttons in the group.

method.name: name
method.description: Returns the name of the group.
method.return: A String representing the name of the group.

method.name: selection
method.description: Returns the currently selected radio button.

classRec.name: SegmentedControl
classRec.description:
A segmented control is a series of connected radio buttons that enable the user to select a single item from a list of multiple items.

You can skin the SegmentedControl component by defining the background skin and the button skins for the segmented control.

Event.name: change
Event.description: Dispatches a change event when the selection of the control changes.

method.name: SegmentedControl
method.description: Creates a new SegmentedControl instance.

method.name: addItemAt
method.description:
Adds an item to the DataProvider at a given index.

Adding or removing an item fires a data provider event, which causes the columns to be cleared and redrawn.
method.param: item The item to add.
index The index at which to add the item.

method.name: addItem
method.description:
Adds an item to the DataProvider.

Adding or removing an item fires a data provider event, which causes the columns to be cleared and redrawn.
method.param: item The object to add to the DataProvider.

method.name: addItemsAt
method.description: Adds an array item at the specified index.
method.param: items The array of items to add.
index The index, or offset, at which to add the items.
method.throws: RangeError Thrown if the specified index is less than 0, or greater than or equal to the length of the data provider.

method.name: getItemAt
method.description:
Gets the data object from the dataProvider at a given index.

Adding or removing an item fires a data provider event, which causes the columns to be cleared and redrawn.
method.param: index The index at which to return the item.

method.name: removeAll
method.description:
Removes all items from the DataProvider.

Adding or removing an item fires a data provider event, which causes the columns to be cleared and redrawn.

method.name: removeItemAt
method.description:
Removes an item from the DataProvider at a given index.

Adding or removing an item fires a data provider event, which causes the columns to be cleared and redrawn.
method.param: index The index location at which to remove the item.

method.name: removeItem
method.description:
Removes an item from the DataProvider.

Adding or removing an item fires a data provider event, which causes the columns to be cleared and redrawn.
method.param: item The item to remove.

method.name: replaceItemAt
method.description:
Replaces the data at a given index.

Adding or removing an item fires a data provider event, which causes the columns to be cleared and redrawn.
method.param: item The new item to add.
index The index at which to add the itemm.

method.name: replaceItem
method.description: Replaces an item with a new item.
method.param: item The new item.
oldObject The current item to replace.
method.throws: RangeError Thrown if the specified index is less than 0, or greater than or equal to the length of the data provider.

method.name: setBackgroundSkin
method.description: Sets the background skin for the segmented control, given a skin object.
method.param: skin The skin to use for the background of the segmented control.

method.name: setButtonSize
method.param: button - current Radio Button to initialize
height - height of the component
width - width of each button based on total width of component and number of buttons to draw

method.name: setButtonSkin
method.description: Sets the button skin for the buttons in the segmented control.
method.param: skin The button skin.

method.name: setButtonWidthAtIndex
method.description:
Sets the button width of an item at the specified index.

This operation will override the current width and height of this control, other button widths will not be changed.
method.param: width The new width to set. The default is 100 (pixels).
index The index of the button to set. The default is 0.

method.name: updateItemAt
method.description: Updates the item at the specified index with a new item.
method.param: item The new item.
index The index of the item to replace.
method.throws: RangeError Thrown if the specified index is less than 0, or greater than or equal to the length of the data provider.

method.name: updateItem
method.description: Updates an item with a new item at the same position in the data provider.
method.param: item The new item.
oldObject The current item to replace.
method.throws: RangeError Thrown if the specified index is less than 0, or greater than or equal to the length of the data provider.

method.name: dataProvider
method.description:
Gets or sets the DataProvider object used by the segmented control.

This method is used to draw the columns and apply the data object to each one.

method.description: Gets or sets the currently selected index.
method.return: An Integer representing the currently selected index, or -1 if no index is selected.

method.name: selectedItem

method.name: dataProvider

classRec.name: ToggleSwitch
classRec.description:
The ToggleSwitch represents a button that has one of two states indicating an "ON" or "OFF" type state.

A toggle switch has a thumb that can be dragged like a Slider but differs in functionality where if you click the track or background of the Toggle Switch, it will change the selected state of the switch.

A toggle switch is comprised of a track, thumb and fill and two text labels.

method.name: ToggleSwitch
method.description: Creates a ToggleSwitch instance.

method.name: getTextFormatForState
method.description: Returns the TextFormat object for a specified state.
method.param: state The state for the TextFormat object to return.
method.return: The TextFormat object for the specified state.

method.name: setLabels
method.param: items Array of labels to set in the text field

method.name: setTextFormatForState
method.description: Sets the TextFormat object for the label for a given state. Valid states are: SkinStates.UP, SkinStates.DOWN, SkinStates.SELECTED, SkinStates.DISABLED.
method.param: format The TextFormat to set.
state The state for which to change the TextFormat.

method.name: defaultLabel
method.description: Gets or sets the String text for the default or OFF label.

method.name: selectedLabel
method.description: Gets or sets the String text for the selected or ON label.

method.name: selected
method.description:
Gets or sets the value of the switch (the position of the thumb).

true for ON, selected, false for OFF, unselected.
method.return: Returns a Boolean indicating if the switch is in the selected state.

method.name: defaultLabel
method.description: Sets the text of the default label.
method.param: _defaultLabel:String

method.name: selectedLabel
method.description: Sets the text of the selected label, or OFF label
method.param: _defaultLabel:String

method.name: selected
method.description: Determines the position of the thumb based on the selected value parameter
method.param: bool Boolean

classRec.name: Button
classRec.description:
The Button class represents a common button.

A button consists of a skin, which changes based on the current state of the button. You can create a custom skin by implementing the ISkin interface. A button has an up, down, selected, and disabled state.

You can also use the toggle method to make the button behave like a toggle switch.

method.name: Button
method.description: Constructs a Button instance.

method.name: selected
method.description: Gets or sets the selected property of the button.
method.return: A Boolean indicating if the button is in selected mode.

method.name: toggle
method.description: Gets or sets the toggle property of the button. When set to true, the button's selected state is toggled when the button is released.
method.return: A Boolean indicating if the button is in toggle mode.

classRec.name: LabelButton
classRec.description: The LabelButton class enables you to add a label to your button.

method.name: LabelButton
method.description: Creates a new LabelButton instance.

method.name: getTextFormatForState
method.description: Returns the TextFormat object for a specified state.
method.param: state The state for the TextFormat object to return.
method.return: The TextFormat object for the specified state.

method.name: initializeTextFormatForState
method.param: state The state for which to initialize the TextFormat object.

method.name: setTextFormatForState
method.description: Sets the TextFormat object for the label for a given state. Valid states are: SkinStates.UP, SkinStates.DOWN, SkinStates.SELECTED, SkinStates.DISABLED.
method.param: format The TextFormat to set.
state The state for which to change the TextFormat.

method.name: embedFonts
method.description:
Gets or sets the embedFonts property of the internal TextField of the LabelButton.

When set to false, fonts are rendered as device fonts. When set to true, you must specify a font using the font property of a TextFormat object and set it using the setTextFormatForState() method.

This font must be included in your application. If it is not included, the text will not be rendererd.

method.name: label
method.description: Gets or sets the label for the button.

method.description: Sets the icon for the Button. The icon is positioned in the center of the button.
method.param: image The icon to be set. A String representing the URL to an external image, a Bitmap instance, or a BitmapData instance.

classRec.name: DropDownButton
classRec.description: The DropDownButton class represents the top button in the DropDown list. It contains the label used to highlight the selected item. You can click on the DropDownButton to open and close the list.

method.description: Constructor for a QNXApplicationEvent instance.
method.param: type The type of event.

field.name: LOW_MEMORY
field.description: Dispatched when the device is running low on memory. When this event is received you should save the state and free as many resources as possible. When the device is running low on memory, it will begin terminating applications in order to free up more memory.

field.name: SWIPE_DOWN
field.description: Dispatched when a user swipes down from the top bezel of the device onto the screen.

field.name: SWIPE_START
field.description: Dispatched when the user starts a swipe from the top bezel of the device.

classRec.name: MediaServiceRequestEvent
classRec.description: The MediaServiceRequestEvent class provides events related to media service requests, such as track change or play and pause requests.

method.name: MediaServiceRequestEvent
method.description: Creates a new MediaServiceRequestEvent instance given an event type.
method.param: type The event type.

field.name: TRACK_NEXT
field.description: Dispatched when the media service has requested you to change playback to the next track.

field.name: TRACK_PAUSE
field.description: Dispatched when the media service has requested you to pause playback.

field.name: TRACK_PLAY
field.description: Dispatched when the media service has requested that you start playback.

field.name: TRACK_PREV
field.description: Dispatched when the media service has requested you to change playback to the previous track.

classRec.name: MediaPlayerEvent
classRec.description: The MediaPlayerEvent class provides event type functionality related to media player operation and media playback.

bubbles A Boolean indicating whether or not the event supports event bubbling. Default is false.
cancelable A Boolean indicating whether or not the event can be cancelled. Default is false.

method.name: what
method.description:
Indicates what has changed, this object will contain a property with a value be set to true indicating the change. genre
PropertyWhat changed
durationMediaPlayer.duration
trackIndexMediaPlayer.trackIndex
positionMediaPlayer.position
mediaTypeMediaPlayer.mediaType
nameMediaPlayer.metadata.name
albumMediaPlayer.metadata.album
artistMediaPlayer.metadata.artist
genreMediaPlayer.metadata.genre
commentMediaPlayer.metadata.comment
bitrateMediaPlayer.metadata.bitrate
urlMediaPlayer.metadata.url
trackMediaPlayer.metadata.track
video_widthMediaPlayer.metadata.video_width
video_heightMediaPlayer.metadata.video_height

field.name: BUFFER_CHANGE
field.description: Dispatched when buffer levels change.

field.name: INFO_CHANGE
field.description: Dispatched to communicate some information and/or warning about the media or its playback.

field.name: PREPARE_COMPLETE

classRec.name: DeviceBatteryEvent
classRec.description: The DeviceBatteryEvent class provides battery level and state change event functionality.

method.param: type The type of the event.
batteryState The battery state.
batteryLevel The battery level.

method.name: batteryLevel
method.description: Gets the battery level of the device ranging from 0 to 100.
method.return: An integer representing the battery level.

method.name: batteryState
method.description: Gets the battery state of the device.
method.return: An integer representing the current battery state.

field.name: LEVEL_CHANGE
field.description: Dispatched when a battery level change occurs.

field.name: STATE_CHANGE
field.description: Dispatched when a battery state change occurs.

method.name: NotificationEvent
method.description:
Creates a notification manager event object. The following event types can be generated:
CONNECT, DISCONNECT, REGISTER, NOTIFY_NEW, NOTIFY_UPDATE, NOTIFY_ACKNOWLEDGE, NOTIFY_EXPIRE and NOTIFY_CANCEL.
method.param: type The type of notification event being created.
clientId The string that uniquely identifies the connection to the service that is generating the event.
id When specified, the string that uniquely identifies the notification within the connection to the service.

field.name: CONNECT
field.description: Signifies that a connection (identified by id) has been added to the service.

field.name: DISCONNECT
field.description:
Signifies that a connection (identified by id) has been removed from the service.
From the service's perspective, all active notifications submitted through the connection
are removed from the system.

field.name: NOTIFY_ACKNOWLEDGE
field.description:
Signifies that the specified notification for the specified client has been
acknowledged by the user. If id is null, this event signifies that all notifications
for the specified client have been acknowledged. This event is only provided back to a
client if the notifyOnAcknowledge property of the notification was set to true.

field.name: NOTIFY_CANCEL
field.description:
Signifies that the specified notification for the given client has been cancelled. If id
is null, all notifications for the client are cancelled.

field.name: NOTIFY_EXPIRE
field.description:
Signifies that the specified notification for the specified client has expired. If id
is null, this event signifies that all notifications for the specified client have expired.
This event is only provided back to a client if the notifyOnExpire property of the
notification was set to true.

field.name: NOTIFY_NEW
field.description: Signifies that a new notification for the given client has been submitted.

field.name: NOTIFY_UPDATE
field.description: Signifies that the specified notification for the given client has been updated.

field.name: PROVIDER
field.description: Signifies that the specified client has identified themself to the service.

field.name: clientId
field.description: The string that uniquely identifies a connection to the service (specified for all events).

field.name: id
field.description: The string that uniquely identifies the notification within the client of the service.

classRec.name: KeyboardType
classRec.description:
The KeyboardType class contains constants that define the layout of the keyboard that appears when the user clicks in a textInput component. For example, you can enable an email-specific keyboard when the user clicks in a textInput component that takes an email address.

The following code listing creates an email-specific keyboard:

firstInput = new TextInput; firstInput.keyboardType = KeyboardType.EMAIL; firstInput.width = 200;

field.name: DEFAULT
field.description: The default keyboard layout.

field.name: EMAIL
field.description: The email-specific keyboard layout.

field.name: PHONE
field.description: The email-specific keyboard layout.

field.name: PIN
field.description: The email-specific keyboard layout.

field.name: URL
field.description: The URL-specific keyboard layout (for entering web addresses).

classRec.name: ReturnKeyType
classRec.description:
The ReturnKeyType class contains constants that define the Enter key that will appear on the keyboard when the user clicks in a TextInput component. The following listing creates a URL-specific keyboard with a Join key. firstInput = new TextInput; firstInput.keyboardType = KeyboardType.URL; firstInput.returnKeyType = ReturnKeyType.JOIN; firstInput.width = 200;

The listing above creates the following keyboard:

field.name: CONNECT
field.description: The Connect key.

field.name: DEFAULT
field.description: The default key (Enter).

field.name: DONE
field.description: The Done key.

field.name: GO
field.description: The Go key.

field.name: JOIN
field.description: The Join key.

field.name: NEXT
field.description: The Next key.

field.name: SEARCH
field.description: The Search key.

field.name: SEND
field.description: The Send key.

field.name: SUBMIT
field.description: The Submit key.

field.name: NEVER

field.name: UNLESS_EDITING

field.name: WHILE_EDITING

classRec.name: Label
classRec.description: The Label class displays formatted text. The Label class cannot recieve focus and cannot be used for input.

method.name: Label
method.description: Creates a new Label instance.

method.name: autoSize
method.description:
Gets or sets a string that indicates how a label is sized and aligned to fit the value of its text property.

The following are valid values:

  • TextFieldAutoSize.NONE: The label is not resized or aligned to fit the text.
  • TextFieldAutoSize.LEFT: The right and bottom sides of the label are resized to fit the text. The left and top sides are not resized.
  • TextFieldAutoSize.CENTER: The left and right sides of the label resize to fit the text. The horizontal center of the label stays anchored at its original horizontal center position.
  • TextFieldAutoSize.RIGHT: The left and bottom sides of the label are resized to fit the text. The top and right sides are not resized.

method.name: embedFonts
method.description: Gets or sets the embedFonts property of the internal TextField of the label. When set to false, fonts are rendered as device fonts. When set to true, you must specify a font using the font property of a TextFormat object and set it to the format property. This font must be included in the in your application. If it is not included, the text will not be rendererd.

method.name: format
method.description:
Gets or sets the TextFormat object of the label.

The TextFormat object is used to format and style the text of the label. The label has the following default text format:

  • format.size = 16;
  • format.font = "BBAlpha Sans";
  • format.color = 0xFFFFFF;

method.name: htmlText
method.description: Gets or sets the html text of the label

method.name: multiline
method.description: Gets or sets a Boolean that determines whether or not the TextField supports multiline display.

method.name: selectable
method.description: Gets or sets a Boolean that determines whether or not the text can be selected.

method.name: textField
method.description: Gets a reference to the internal textField of the label.
method.return: The textField of the current label.

method.name: textHeight
method.description: Returns the height of the label text (in pixels).

method.name: textWidth
method.description: Returns the width of the label text (in pixels).

method.name: text
method.description: Gets or sets the text of the label.

method.name: wordWrap
method.description: Gets or sets a Boolean that determines whether or not the label supports word wrapping.

Event.name: change
Event.description: Change event dispatched when the text in the input field is modified.

method.name: TextInput
method.description: Creates a TextInput instance.

method.return: Returns the rectangle in which the left icon occupies.

method.name: getRightIconRect

method.return: Returns the rectangle in which the right icon occupies.

method.name: setText
method.param: str The label for the text field.

method.name: autoSize
method.description:
Gets or sets a string that indicates how a label is sized and aligned to fit the value of its text property.

The following are valid values:

  • TextFieldAutoSize.NONE: The label is not resized or aligned to fit the text.
  • TextFieldAutoSize.LEFT: The right and bottom sides of the label are resized to fit the text. The left and top sides are not resized.
  • TextFieldAutoSize.CENTER: The left and right sides of the label resize to fit the text. The horizontal center of the label stays anchored at its original horizontal center position.
  • TextFieldAutoSize.RIGHT: The left and bottom sides of the label are resized to fit the text. The top and right sides are not resized.

method.name: clearIconMode
method.description: Gets or sets a value that determines how the clear button appears in the text field.

method.name: displayAsPassword
method.description: Gets or sets a Boolean that determines whether text should be masked.

method.name: embedFonts
method.description: Gets or sets the embedFonts property of the internal TextField of the label. When set to false, fonts are rendered as device fonts. When set to true, you must specify a font using the font property of a TextFormat object and set it to the format property. This font must be included in the in your application. If it is not included, the text will not be rendererd.

method.name: format
method.description:
Gets or sets the TextFormat object of the label.

The TextFormat object is used to format and style the text of the label. The label has the following default text format:

  • format.size = 16;
  • format.font = "BBAlpha Sans";
  • format.color = 0xFFFFFF;

method.name: leftIconMode
method.description: Gets or sets a value that controls how the left icon is displayed in the text field.

method.name: leftIcon
method.description:
Gets or sets the left icon for the TextInput component.

The icon is sized and positioned according to the value that is returned from the getLeftIconRect method.

method.name: prompt
method.description: Gets or sets the placeholder text that is displayed in the text field when there is no other text in the text field.

method.name: rightIconMode
method.description: Gets or sets a value that controls how the right icon is displayed in the text field.

method.name: rightIcon
method.description: Gets or sets the right icon for the TextInput component. The icon is sized and positioned according to the value that is returned from the getRightIconRect method.

method.name: textField
method.description: Gets a reference to the internal TextField of the Label.

method.name: textHeight
method.description: Returns the height of the text in the label (in pixels).

method.name: textWidth
method.description: Returns the width of the text in the label (in pixels).

method.name: text
method.description: Gets or sets the text String of the label.

method.name: keyboardType
method.description: The virtual keyboard type to use when this text input has focus.

method.name: returnKeyType

method.name: NotificationProvider
method.description: Creates the object that describes the notification provider that is connected to the notification service.

field.name: ICON_DECORATION_NEW
field.description: Constant identifier for the new icon decoration.

field.name: ICON_DECORATION_OLD
field.description: Constant identifier for the old icon decoration.

field.name: ICON_DECORATION_UNKNOWN
field.description: Constant identifier for the unknown icon decoration.

field.name: appUrl
field.description: The URL, specified as a valid Unix path, to the application. The user can run the application by selecting or opening the notifcation.

field.name: count
field.description: Summary count of new, unread, ... items. The count is displayed alongside the icon for the client in the notification status area.

field.name: iconDecoration
field.description:
Specifies the type of decoration to be applied to the icon. This member is ignored if iconUrl is not specified. Possible values are:
  • ICON_DECORATION_NEW
  • ICON_DECORATION_OLD
  • ICON_DECORATION_UNKNOWN

or null to specify no decoration.

The following listing creates a NotificationProvider instance given a title, URL to an icon, and icon decoration.

mynp = new NotificationProvider(); mynp.clientId = myapp_id; mynp.title = 'My mail client app'; mynp.iconUrl = '/mailapp/mail.png'; mynp.iconDecoration = NotificationProvider.ICON_DECORATION_NEW;

field.name: iconUrl
field.description:
URL (as a Unix path) to the icon representing the summary state of the notification client. The icon is displayed in the
notification status area of the system status screen.

field.name: priority
field.description:
The priority of this provider indication relative to other providers in the system. Depending on the capabilities of the view, providers with higher priorities can be displayed ahead of those with lower priorities.

The higher the specified value, the higher the provider priority.

field.name: title
field.description: A string representing the title or name of the provider. This string can be displayed to the user.

method.name: Notification
method.description:
Creates an object that describes the notification. The notification instance is identified by unique ID, where each unique ID is associated
with a specified client.
method.param: clientId The ID of the client that submitted the notification (unique to the notification manager server).
id The ID of the notification (unique to the client owner).
iconUrl The URL (as a Unix path) to the icon that represents the notification.

field.name: LED_BLUE
field.description: Constant identifier for the blue LED.

field.name: LED_GREEN
field.description: Constant identifier for the green LED.

field.name: LED_RED
field.description: Constant identifier for the red LED.

field.name: LED_YELLOW
field.description: Constant identifier for the yellow LED.

field.name: PRIORITY_HIGH
field.description: High notification priority.

field.name: PRIORITY_LOW
field.description: Low (default) notifcation priority.

field.name: PRIORITY_MEDIUM
field.description: Medium notification priority.

field.name: appUrl
field.description: The URL, specified as a valid Unix path, to the application. The user can run the application by selecting or opening the notifcation.

field.name: decorationAreas
field.description:
An array of objects (corresponding to the decorationUrls) that define the sub-areas of the decoration images that will be used to overlay the notification icon .

Each object in this array is expected to supply x, y, width and height member properties, as numbers, which define the sub areas of the images to be used as the decoration overlays.

If decorationAreas is null (or any entry in the array), the entire area for the image decoration will be used as the decoration overlay.

field.name: decorationUrls
field.description:
An array of URLs to images which will be overlayed on the notification icon as additional decorations. Decoration images will be layered on top of the notification icon in the same order in which they appear in the array.

If decorationUrls is null, no decoration will be applied to the icon.

field.name: expirationTime
field.description:
Specifies the absolute time (as a GMT-based timestamp) for the expiration of the notification, or specified relative time (applied to the notification's time) in ms afterwhich the notification will expire. A value of 0 indicates this is not specified.

When a notification expires, it is automatically cancelled by the notification manager (NotificationManager). /p> In the following listing, the expirationTime property is set using the getTime function:

var d:Date = new Date(); notification.time = d.getTime(); notification.expirationTime = notification.time + 60000;

The expiration time is specified relative to the notification start time by adding 60000 ms, or one minute, to the start time. The notification will appear on the screen for one minute.

field.name: htmlText
field.description: An HTML-formatted text string. If set, this value overrides any text attribute that was specified by the text attribute.

field.name: iconArea
field.description:
An object that defines the sub-area of the icon image that will be displayed as the notification icon.

When present, the object is expected to supply x, y, width and height number members, which defines the pixel sub area of the image to be used as the icon.

If iconArea is null, the entire image area is used for the icon.

field.name: iconUrl
field.description:
The URL, specified as a valid Unix path, to the icon representing the notification. This icon
is displayed in the notification list if the system status screen when the notification is created.

field.name: id
field.description: The ID of the notification. The ID is unique to the client owner.

field.name: led
field.description: Color identifier for the LED that will blink with this notification. Possible values are LED_RED, LED_GREEN, LED_YELLOW, LED_BLUE, or null if not specified.

field.name: notifyOnAcknowledge
field.description: Set to true to have the notification manager (NotificationManager) notify you when the user acknowledges this notification.

field.name: notifyOnExpire
field.description: Set to true to have the notification manager (NotificationManager) notify you when the notification expires.

field.name: priority
field.description:
The priority of this notification relative to other notifications in the system. Depending on the capabilities of the view, notifications with higher priorities can be displayed ahead of those with lower priorities.

The higher the specified value, the higher the notification priority.

field.name: soundRepeat
field.description: The number of times to repeat the sound, or 0 to play the sound only once.

field.name: soundUrl
field.description:
The URL, specified as a valid Unix path, to the system sound file to play when the notification is created.
Null if not specified.

field.name: text
field.description:
One of either a string or an array that describes the notification. A string specifies a single text element that describes the notification.
An array specifies a number of strings that describe the notification.

field.name: time
field.description: A GMT-based timestamp (expressed as ms since 1970) for the notification. A value of 0 indicates that a time has not specified.

method.name: NotificationInterface
method.description: Construct a new NotificationInterface using the provided client descriptor.

method.name: acknowledge
method.description: Called by the server to inform the client that a notification has been acknowledged by the user. If the notification has notifyOnAcknowledge set, a NOTIFICATION_ACKNOWLEDGED event will be sent to the client.
method.param: notification The notification being acknowledged.

method.name: cancel
method.description: Cancel an existing notification in the system.
method.param: notification The notification to cancel.

method.name: close
method.description: Close the connection.

method.name: expire
method.description: Called by the server to inform the client that a notification has expired. If the notification has cancelOnExpire set, the notification will be cancelled by the server and no event will be sent to the client.
method.param: notification The notification that is to expire.

method.name: identify
method.description: Identify the notification provider to the notification service.
method.param: provider The object that describes the notification provider.

method.name: notify
method.description: Submit a new notification to the system, or update an existing notification.
method.param: notification The notification to submit or update.

method.name: open
method.description: Open the connection (as the server or as a client).

method.name: NotificationManager
method.description: Construct a new client using the client descriptor provided.

interfaceRec.name: IProgress
interfaceRec.description: The interface for components that show progress.

method.name: progress
method.description: Gets and sets the current progress.

classRec.name: ProgressBar
classRec.description:
The ProgressBar class is a basic class that shows progress by percentage.

The ProgressBar class provides the temporal feedback functionality for the API. You can use the progress bar to show progress information for processor-intensive operations or to show progress information whenever data is being loaded. This feedback ensures the user that the operating system remains responsive during complex operations.

method.name: ProgressBar
method.description: Creates a new ProgressBar instance.

method.name: progress
method.description: Gets or sets the current progress value as indicated by the progress bar. The value is returned as a percentage.

method.name: progress
method.description: Percent is used to draw the visuals
method.param: progress Percent number

classRec.name: Image
classRec.description: The Image class displays an image. It can display an image by using a URL to an image, a Bitmap instance or a BitmapData instance.

Event.name: ioError
Event.description: Dispatched when the image cannot be loaded.

Event.name: complete
Event.description: Dispatched when the image is loaded and ready to be used.

method.name: Image
method.description: Constructs an Image instance.

method.name: setImage
method.description: Sets the image. The image parameter can be of type String as a URL to an external image, Bitmap instance or a BitmapData instance.
method.param: image The image to be set.

method.name: cache
method.description: Gets or sets the ImageCache object to use to cache the image.

method.name: pixelSnapping
method.description:
Controls whether or not the Bitmap object is snapped to the nearest pixel. The PixelSnapping class includes possible values:
  • PixelSnapping.NEVERNo pixel snapping occurs.
  • PixelSnapping.ALWAYSThe image is always snapped to the nearest pixel, independent of transformation.
  • PixelSnapping.AUTOThe image is snapped to the nearest pixel if it is drawn with no rotation or skew and it is drawn at a scale factor of 99.9% to 100.1%. If these conditions are satisfied, the bitmap image is drawn at 100% scale, snapped to the nearest pixel. Internally, this value allows the image to be drawn as fast as possible using the vector renderer.

method.name: smoothing
method.description: Controls whether or not the bitmap is smoothed when scaled. If true, the bitmap is smoothed when scaled. If false, the bitmap is not smoothed when scaled.

classRec.name: TimeFormatter
classRec.description:
The TimeFormatter class contains utility methods that format a given number (seconds or milliseconds) into a time value.

The Number is returned as a String.

method.name: formatMilliseconds
method.description: Returns a String in the format hours:mins:secs given a Number.
method.param: milliseconds The Number for which to return the formatted String.
method.return: A colon-delimited String containing the Number expressed in hours, minutes, and seconds.

method.name: formatSeconds
method.description: Returns a String containing the number of seconds in a given Number.
method.param: seconds The Number for which to return the formatted String.
method.return: A String containing the number of seconds.

classRec.name: ImageCache
classRec.description: The ImageCache class provides image caching functionality for your application. The class can be used in conjuction with the Image component class.

Event.name: imageLoadError
Event.description: Dispatched when an image has been requested but failed to load.

Event.name: imageLoaded
Event.description: Dispatched when an image has been requested but was not available in the cache.

method.name: ImageCache
method.description: Creates a new ImageCache instance.

method.name: addImageData
method.description:
Updates the bitmap image data for an element in the cache given a URL to the image and new bitmap data.

This method will dispatch an ImageCacheEvent.IMAGE_LOADED event, so listeners can update automatically.
method.param: url The URL to the image.
data The new bitmap data for the image.

method.name: clear
method.description: Clear the image cache and disposes the BitmapData.
method.param: force If true ALL images will be disposed, including one whch may be on the stage, if false only unlocked images will be disposed

method.name: getImage
method.description:
Returns an image from the cache, given the URL of the image and a Boolean that determines whether or not to load the image from the URL provided.

If the image is in the cache it is locked before it is returned. It must be unlocked when no longer in use.
method.param: url The URL to the image.
load A Boolean indicating whether or not to load the image.

method.name: reloadImage
method.description:
Reloads an image from the cache given the URL to the image.

If the image is not in the cache nothing is done.
method.param: url The URL to the image.

method.name: unlock
method.description:
Unlocks an image in the cache, given a URL to the image.

An unlocked image can be flushed from cache if space is required.
method.param: url The URL to the image.

method.name: cacheSize
method.description: Gets or sets the cache size for your image cache given an integer representing the number of images to cache.

classRec.name: DataProvider
classRec.description: The DataProvider class provides a linear representation of a set of data and methods to enable modification of the data. List classes, such as the List and TileList use the DataProvider class in order to handle their data.

Event.name: dataChange
Event.description: Data Change event dispatched when data is modified.

method.param: dp An Array containing the initial set of items.
dispatchCreate Setting this value to true causes a DataProviderEvent.UPDATE_ALL event to occur on creation. This parameter is set to false by default.

classRec.name: SectionDataProvider
classRec.description:
The SectionDataProvider class provides a tree type representation of a set of data and methods to enable modification of the data. The SectionDataProvider class provides data in a sectioned list, where a single list contains multiple items, with each item containing a list of children. The SectionDataProvider class is useful for showing more complex data lists, such as a calendar of dates, or a catalog of related products.

The SectionList and SectionTileList classes use the SectionDataProvider class in order to handle their data.

initChildren Initialize the children in the Dictionary.

classRec.name: Locale
classRec.description:
The Locale class represents a specific locale.

This class can be used to change or access some locale-specific items. To change the locale of the entire application, you must use the LocaleManager class.

Event.name: complete
Event.description: Dispatched after a property file has been successfully loaded and parsed.

method.name: Locale
method.description: Creates a new Locale instance given an ID.
method.param: locale_id A String representing the ID of the locale. For example, en_US.
loadResource An optional parameter that, when set to true, loads the resource.property file for the locale upon creation. The default value is false.

method.name: getResource
method.description: Returns the resource for the specified key from the currently loaded localization file.
method.param: key The key of the resource that is returned.
args Optional parameters that can be used as wildcard replacements in the returned String.
method.return: A String representing the value of the key in the localization file.

method.name: loadResources
method.description: Loads the resource property file for the current locale. This method attempts to load a file in the following path locale/locale id/resource.properties, where locale id is the current locale ID.

method.name: id
method.description: Gets the ID of the locale.
method.return: A String representing the ID of the locale.

classRec.name: LocaleManager
classRec.description: The LocaleManager manages system locale changes enabling you to both listen for system locale changes and set the locale of an application. You can place a resource String file in the following folder in the root of your application directory: locale/<locale id>/resource.properties where <locale id> is a valid locale ID, such as en_US. You can place any other localized assets in this folder, such as images and fonts. The getLocalePath() function returns the path to the current locale directory. The path is relative to the current application directory.

Event.name: change
Event.description: Dispatched when a locale has been changed and the associated localization resources have finished loading.

method.name: LocaleManager
method.description:
Do not instantiate the LocaleManager by using this constructor.

Instead, use the LocaleManager.localeManager property to return the Singleton instance.

method.name: getCurrentLocale
method.description: Returns the current locale of the application.
method.return: The ID of the current locale.

method.name: getDeviceLocale
method.description: Returns the current locale of the device.
method.return: The ID of the current locale.

method.name: getLocalePath
method.description:
Returns the path from the application directory to the current locale directory in the format, locale/{locale id}/.

You can place any localized asset in its locale directory. This path allows you to reference an asset in the currently selected locale.
method.return: The path to the current locale folder.

method.name: getResource
method.description: Returns the resource for the specified key from the currently loaded localization file.
method.param: key The key of the resource to be returned.
args Optional parameters that can be used as wildcard replacements in the returned String.
method.return: A String representing the value of the key in the localization file.

method.name: setLocale
method.description:
Sets the locale of the application, given the locale ID.

This function dispatches a flash.events.Event.CHANGE event when the current locale resources have been loaded and parsed.
method.param: locale The ID of the locale.

method.name: localeManager
method.description:
Returns the Singleton instance of the LocaleManager. You can only instantiate a single instance in an application.

The following example returns an instance of the LocaleManager:

var categories:Object = new Object(); categories.label = LocaleManager.localeManager.getResource("menu_item_categories");

Do not instantiate the LocaleManager from its public constructor.
method.return: Returns the Singleton instance of the LocaleManager.

field.name: DEFAULT_LOCALE
field.description: A String representing the default locale of the device.

field.name: LOCALE_FOLDER
field.description: A String representing the location of the locale folder.

classRec.name: LocaleResourceBundle
classRec.description:
The LocaleResourceBundle class loads and parses localized String files.

The following parsing rules are supported:

  • Lines starting with "#" or "!" are not parsed and are considered comments.
  • Any whitespace on the left of the "=" symbol is stripped out and the resulting value is used as the key.
  • Any whitespace at the start of the value, to the right of the "=" symbol, is stripped out.
  • To include whitespace at the beginning of your value, add a "\" to the beginning of the String in order to escape it.
  • Any whitespace at the end of a value is preserved and is not stripped out.
  • You can combine multi-line values by adding a "\" at the end of the line.

Your String can also contain wildcard replacements, which are replaced when a String is returned. For example: wildcard=And a %1% and a %2% and a %3%

To replace the wildcards, add additional parameters to a getResource method call, such as LocaleManager.localeManager.getResource( "wildcard", 1,2,3 );

Event.name: complete
Event.description: Dispatched after a property file has been successfully loaded and parsed.

method.name: LocaleResourceBundle
method.description: Creates an instance of a local resource bundle.

method.name: getResource
method.description: Returns the value for the specified key from the loaded property file.
method.param: key The key for the value in the property file.
args Optional parameters that can be used as wildcard replacements in the returned String.
method.return: Returns the value for the specified key.

method.name: load
method.param: path The path to the property file to be loaded.

method.name: open
method.param: file The file object to open and parse.

method.name: loaded
method.description: Returns true if a property file has been loaded and parsed.
method.return: A Boolean indicating whether or not the property file has been loaded and parsed.

classRec.name: Slider

method.name: Slider
method.description: Creates a new Slider instance.

method.name: setFillSkin
method.description: Sets the fill skin for the slider.
method.param: skin The fill skin to set.

method.name: setThumbSkin
method.description: Sets the skin for the slider thumb button.
method.param: skin The button skin to set.

method.name: setTrackSkin
method.description: Sets the skin for the track of the slider.
method.param: skin The track skin to set.

method.name: active
method.description:
Gets or sets the active property of the slider.

The active property is used to determine whether or not the user can interact with the slider. If set to false, the slider can only be used for display purposes.

method.name: maximum
method.description:
Gets or sets the maximum value of the slider.

The maximum value represents the very right extent of the track.

method.name: minimum
method.description:
Gets or sets the minimum value of the slider.

The minimum value represents the very left extent of the track.

method.name: value
method.description:
Gets or sets the value of the slider.

Setting this property will cause the thumb to update its position. This value is updated as the user drags the slider thumb.

The value is constrained to be within the minimum and maximum values.

method.name: active
method.description:
Gets or sets the active property of the slider.

The active property is used to determine whether or not the user can interact with the slider. If set to false, the slider can only be used for display purposes.

classRec.name: VolumeSlider
classRec.description:
The volume slider component provides the functionality for implementing a volume control.

The volume slider differs from the base Slider class in that it has a specific look and feel and is used for media-based components.

method.name: VolumeSlider
method.description: Creates a VolumeSlider instance.

method.name: setThumbSkin
method.description:
Sets the thumb skin.

This function expects a skin that extends IProgress.
method.param: value The skin object to use of the thumb.

method.name: disabledColors
method.description:
Gets or sets the colors that are used to draw the disabled fill gradient; the gradient that appears when the control is disabled.

This function expects an array of two values, representing the colors used to create the gradient.

method.name: fillColors
method.description:
Gets or sets the fill colors that are used to draw the inside gradient.

This function expects an array of two values, representing the colors used to create the gradient.

Event.name: close
Event.description: Dispatched when the picker closes.

Event.description: Dispatched when picker opens

Event.description: Dispatched when the DataProvider changes for the picker component.

Event.description: Dispatched when the user selects an item from a column in the picker.

method.name: Picker
method.description: Creates a Picker instance.

method.name: addItemAt
method.description:
Adds an item to the data provider at a given offset.

When you add an item to the data provider, a data provider event is fired causing the data in the picker to be cleared and the picker to be redrawn.
method.param: item The item to add to the data provider.
index The index at which to add the item.

method.name: addItem
method.description:
Adds an item to the data provider.

When you add an item to the data provider, a data provider event is fired causing the data in the picker to be cleared and the picker to be redrawn.
method.param: item The item to add to the data provider.

method.name: addItemsAt
method.description: Adds an array item at the specified index.
method.param: items The array of items to add.
index The index, or offset, at which to add the items.
method.throws: RangeError Thrown if the specified index is less than 0, or greater than or equal to the length of the data provider.

method.name: getButtonSkin
method.description: Returns the button skin for the picker.

method.name: getDividerSkin
method.description: Returns the divider skin.

method.name: getItemAt
method.description:
Get the data object from the data provider at a certain index.

When you add or remove an item from the data provider, a data provider event is fired causing the data in the picker to be cleared and the picker to be redrawn.
method.param: index An integer representing the index for which to get the data.

method.name: getListAt
method.param: index An integer representing the index of the PickerList.

method.name: getListBackgroundSkin
method.description: Returns the skin that is used as the background for the list.
method.return: skin The skin that is used as the backgrdound of the picker.

method.name: getLists
method.description: Returns an array of the lists (columns) used in the picker.

method.name: initializeList
method.param: list The column to be initialized.
dp The data provider that will provide the list with data.

method.name: onListAdded
method.param: list The List that was added.

method.name: onListRemoved
method.param: list The list that was removed.

method.name: positionChild
method.param: child The child to position in the holder.
previousItem The previous item, used to position the child.

method.name: removeAll
method.description:
Removes all items from the data provider.

When you remove an item from the data provider, a data provider event is fired causing the data in the picker to be cleared and the picker to be redrawn.

method.name: removeItemAt
method.description:
Removes an item from the data provider given the index of the item to remove.

When you remove an item from the data provider, a data provider event is fired causing the data in the picker to be cleared and the picker to be redrawn.
method.param: index The index of the item to remove.

method.name: removeItem
method.description:
Removes a given item from the data provider.

When you remove an item from the data provider, a data provider event is fired causing the data in the picker to be cleared and the picker to be redrawn.
method.param: item The item to remove from the data provider.

method.name: replaceItemAt
method.description:
Replaces the item in the data provider at a given index.

When you add or remove an item from the data provider, a data provider event is fired causing the data in the picker to be cleared and the picker to be redrawn.
method.param: item The item to be replaced.
index The index of the item to be replaced. Adding fires a data provider event, which results in the columns being cleared and redrawn

method.name: replaceItem
method.description: Replaces an item, given the new item object and the old item.
method.param: item The new item object data.
oldObject The item to replace.

method.name: setButtonSkin
method.description: Sets the button skin for the picker.
method.param: skin The button skin to set.

method.name: setDividerSkin
method.description: Sets the skin for the divider. The divider separates columns in the picker.
method.param: skin The skin to use as the divider.

method.name: setListBackgroundSkin
method.description: Sets the skin for the background list.
method.param: skin The skin to use as the background of the picker.

method.name: setListIndex
method.param: list List to set the selected index on
index Index of the list

method.name: setListSkinAt
method.description: Sets the list skin given the skin and an index.
method.param: skin The skin to set for the list.
listAtIndex The index of the list.

method.name: setListWidth
method.description:
Sets the width of a list given an index and a width in pixels.

Setting the width through this accessor method, rather than getting the column and setting it directly, ensures that the lists are properly laid out.
method.param: listAtIndex The index at which to set the width.
width The width which will be treated as a ratio with the width of the component.All sizes are added up ( for the columns and then calculated as a percentage of the overall width of the component.

method.name: updateItemAt
method.description: Updates the item in the list at the specified index
method.param: item The updated item.
index The index of the item to update.
method.throws: RangeError The specified index is less than 0 or greater than or equal to the length of the data provider.

method.name: updateItem
method.description: Updates an item in the list, given the new item and the item to update.
method.param: value The new, or updated item.
oldObject The item to update.

method.name: dataProvider
method.description: Gets or sets the data provider.

method.name: data
method.description:
Gets or sets the selected data that is stored in the picker.

Typically, the data is stored as an array of selection objects from each picker list.

method.name: isOpen
method.description:
Gets or sets a value that determines if the picker is open, interactive, and by default showing all lists.

Setting isOpen to true ensures that the picker will stay open and will not react to adjacent or nearby stage mouse events when you click off.
method.param: val A Boolean indicating whether or not the picker is open.

method.name: rowCount
method.description:
Gets or sets an integer that determines the number of rows the Picker will display.

Setting this property, which currently should be 3 or 5 rows, will in turn set the topOffSet property. The topOffSet property determines how much cell offset is required to suggest that the "middle" cell is treated as the "first" cell, therefore requiring a cell number offset from the top. For exampe, a picker with 3 rows has a 1 row offset, while a picker with 5 rows has a 2 row offset.

method.name: selectedIndices
method.description: Gets and sets the selected indicies for the list items

method.name: selectedItems
method.description: Returns selected items

method.name: topOffSet
method.description: Gets the offset from the top cell

method.name: data
method.description: Setter to store the selected items for all the picker column objects.

method.name: defaultListWidth
method.description: Sets the default width for each of the columns in the picker.

method.name: isOpen
method.description:
Gets or sets a value that determines if the picker is open, interactive, and by default showing all lists.

Setting isOpen to true ensures that the picker will stay open and will not react to adjacent or nearby stage mouse events when you click off.
method.param: val A Boolean indicating whether or not the picker is open.

method.name: rowHeight
method.description: Gets or sets the row height property of the list items and the middle section part
method.param: height Height of the row height

method.name: selectedIndices
method.description: Gets and sets the selected indicies for the list items

method.name: selectedItems
method.description: Sets the selected items
method.param: Array of item objects

method.name: topOffSet
method.description: Gets or sets the row offset from the middle cell to the top cell. This ensures that the middle cell is treated as the first cell in the picker. For exampe, a picker with 3 rows has a 1 row offset, while a picker with 5 rows has a 2 row offset.
method.param: val Should be value between 1 or 2

field.name: SIZE_LARGE
field.description: A constant indicating the large picker. The large picker size uses five rows of data.

field.name: SIZE_SMALL
field.description: A constant indicating the small picker. The small picker size uses three rows of data

field.name: __selectedIndices
field.description: Selected indicies for the selected items

classRec.name: CheckBoxSkinWhite
classRec.description:
The CheckBoxSkinWhite class is the default skin for the CheckBox button in the white colour theme.

It provides additional functionality over a regular button skin. For example, the CheckBoxSkinWhite class provides a highlight state that appears when you press down on the button, regardless of whether or not the button is selected.

classRec.name: CheckBoxSkinBlack
classRec.description:
The CheckBoxSkinBlack class is the default skin for the CheckBox button in the dark colour theme.

It provides additional functionality over a regular button skin. For example, the CheckBoxSkinBlack class provides a highlight state that appears when you press down on the button, regardless of whether or not the button is selected.

method.name: CheckBoxSkinBlack
method.description: Creates a new CheckBoxSkinBlack instance.
